Laffey.evaluation: Laffey (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is very balanced between Main Gun, Torpedo, and skill barrages, and further augmented by her self-buffs. Her bulk is also fine due to her Augment module providing a self-heal. Overall, she is a good ship.

Prinz Eugen.evaluation: Prinz Eugen is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and meh skills. Her bulk is very high compared to other tank CAs, but her damage is very very low compared to other tank CAs. Her Augment Module armor break is nice, but doesn't fix her abysmal damage output. Overall, she is a good ship, but is outclassed by other easily accessible options in most situations.

Belfast.evaluation: Belfast is a damage-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is hindered by 1 MGM, but her self-buffs are enough to bring it up to acceptable levels. She also has a smokescreen, which can situationally be useful. She is ideally equipped with an HE CL gun to take full advantage of her self-buff. Overall, she is a good ship.

Arizona.evaluation: Arizona is a support-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty underwhelming, and her healing is too RNG to support a full fleet, even with her Augment module. Collection only.

I-58.evaluation: I-58 is a damage-oriented SS with average stats and great skills. Her personal damage is pretty good for an Elite SS due to her self-buffs. Her buff to other IJN SS is nice, but not needed for her viability. Overall, she is a good SS, especially for newer players, but worse than all the relevant SR SS options.

Jean Bart.evaluation: Jean Bart is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and meh skills. Her Skill 2 self-buff is reliant on using a bad BB gun, and the Augment module doesn't fix it. She also has a preload, but only MGM+1 to compensate for it. Her Augment module barrage is also mediocre at best, but it is free damage. Overall, she is a good ship.

Glorious.evaluation: Glorious is a damage-oriented CV with bad stats and skills. Her augment granted her a 20% cooldown reduction on her first airstrike, which mitigates her slow reload somewhat. Her self-damage is also pretty bad due to 7 planes and average efficiencies. Collection only.

Graf Zeppelin.evaluation: Graf Zeppelin is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good, with her Augment module giving her a carpet-bomb style on-strike barrage, improving her clearing capabilities. She is ideally sortied with an KMS equipment to take full advantage of her self-buffs. Her damage-reduction support to other KMS ships is nice, but not necessary for her to be good. Overall, she is a great ship.

Ayanami.evaluation: Ayanami (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her Main Gun damage is really awful, but her Torpedo damage is among the best in the game, especially when combined with her self-buffs. She is ideally equipped with a fast-firing Main Gun to trigger her skill and All-out-Assault barrage faster for maximum uptime. Overall, she is a great ship, but susceptible to the deficiencies of Torpedo targetting on auto-battle.

Vampire.evaluation: Vampire is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. The heal she provides is not worth the damage loss from using this ship over other options, even with the Augment module enhancing the heal. Collection only.

Karlsruhe.evaluation: Karlsruhe (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Her personal damage is awful, even with her Augment Module, due to only 1 MGM and no good barrages. Collection only.

Montpelier.evaluation: Montpelier is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. She is a very balanced ship, with a great combination of damage, bulk, and AA granted by her skills and Augment Module. She also can buff other CL/CA/CB in the fleet from her Skill 1, however supporting other CL/CA/CB is not required for her to be good. She is ideally sortied with a <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Improved_Hydraulic_Rudder" title="Improved Hydraulic Rudder" >High Performance Hydraulic Steering Gear</a > for maximum bulk as well as her skill requirement. Overall, she is a great ship.

Illustrious.evaluation: Illustrious is a support-oriented CV with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good, with 8 planes and an on-strike rocket barrage. Her support is also good, granting a large shield based on her own max HP to the Vanguard Fleet, and some minor healing along with it. Overall, she is a good ship.

U-557.evaluation: U-557 is a damage-oriented SS with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is meh, and her Augment Module trades damage potential for consistency compared to the <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Dagger" title="Dagger" >Dagger</a >. Collection only.

Le Téméraire.evaluation: Le Téméraire is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is meh due to an aimed barrage from her Skill 1, but even that isn't 100% guarenteed. Her self-buffs help, but don't bring her up to standard. Collection only.

Taihou.evaluation: Taihou is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. She has great personal damage due to her 8 plane loadout, and multiple on-strike barrages, with a 3rd one possible if RNG favors it. One of the barrages offers support to the rest of your Main Fleet as well. She is also very tanky due to possessing Heavy Armor as a CV. Overall, she is a great ship.

Hood.evaluation: Hood is a flagship-oriented BC with good stats and amazing skills. Her barrage is very strong, and has a 100% proc rate, making her a great damage option. She also provides a Reload buff to all Main Fleet ships upon her barrage triggering. Overall, she is a great ship.

Albacore.evaluation: Albacore is a damage-oriented SS with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good for an SR SS, and is further amplified by her DoT and barrages. Overall, she is a great ship; best utilized alongside Archerfish.

Z23.evaluation: Z23 (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to her stats and self-buffs, and her AoA requirement halved. Her bulk is decent, but nothing special. Overall, she is a good ship.

Wichita.evaluation: Wichita is a damage-oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is really high, especially for Elite/SR ships. However, her bulk is frail even with her Augment module. She also offers a FP buff to other CL/CA/CB in the fleet. Overall, she is a good ship.

Nagara.evaluation: Nagara is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Maya.evaluation: Maya is an AA-oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her AA is very high due to an additional AA gun mount from her Augment, and a massive AA self-buff. Her personal damage is also decent now with double Torpedo launches from her Augment module skill upgrade. Her bulk is also good due to her Evasion and Evasion Rate buffs, and stats. Overall, she is a good ship.

Sims.evaluation: Sims (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Her damage is very meh, and her support, while good, is not worth using her for over other damage-oriented options. Collection only.

Javelin.evaluation: Javelin (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her bulk is pretty good, especially for a DD. Her damage is very good due to her Augment module barrage, and she has great mixed damage from her Main Guns and Torpedoes as well. Overall, she is a good ship.

Kagerou.evaluation: Kagerou (Retrofit) is a support-oriented DD with good stats and skills. She has good Torpedo buffs for the Vanguard Fleet, and her own Torpedo damage is pretty good as well. Overall, she is a good ship.

Minneapolis.evaluation: Minneapolis is a mob-tank oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good due to MGM+1 CA guns and her self-buffs when she sinks an enemy. She has average bulk with her base stats, but her Skill 2 further enhances her bulk (and the Vanguard Fleet's bulk with her Augment module). Her Augment Module isn't that amazing, and is a sidegrade to the default Elite Augment modules. Overall, she is a great ship, but can be redundant with other easily accessible options.

Tirpitz.evaluation: Tirpitz is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is very lackluster, and is only brought up to good levels when paired with Bismarck (which isn't worth building your fleet around). Collection only.

Edinburgh.evaluation: Edinburgh is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

Émile Bertin.evaluation: Émile Bertin (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

Gneisenau.evaluation: Gneisenau is an off-flag damage-oriented BC with bad stats and skills. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

Kawakaze.evaluation: Kawakaze is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. With her Augment module, she has great personal damage against all armor types due to her Skill 2 and her Augment module barrage. Her bulk is also decent as well due to the Augment module. Overall, she is a great ship.

Littorio.evaluation: Littorio is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. She doesn't have many self-buffs compared to other BBs, and 130% Main Gun efficiency hinders her shelling damage. Her barrage is still pretty good, however. Overall, she is a great ship.

Z46.evaluation: Z46 is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is really good due to her self-buffs and AoA. She is ideally equipped with an AP main gun to take full advantage of her self-buffs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Saratoga.evaluation: Saratoga (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and amazing skills. Her personal damage is very good due to great on-strike damage, her on-strike barrage with DoT, and a desynced 10s barrage that also does good damage. Her Vanguard Fleet support is nice, but not necessary for her to be good. Overall, she is a great ship.

L'Opiniâtre.evaluation: L'Opiniâtre is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

Mutsuki.evaluation: Mutsuki (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with very bad stats and skills. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

Prince of Wales.evaluation: Prince of Wales is a off-flag support-oriented BB with good stats and great skills. Her skills buff both USS and HMS ships, as well as giving her great self-buffs when sortied with USS or HMS ships. Overall, she is a great ship.
Prince of Wales.preload: 85% 1st Salvo Cooldown Reduction (3+ HMS / USS ships).

Houston.evaluation: Houston is a damage-oriented CA with meh stats and skills. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

Algérie.evaluation: Algérie is a damage-oriented CA with great stats and meh skills. Her damage output is good due to her skill barrage having a proc change on every Main Gun shot. Her bulk is fine, but not enough to tank any hard content reliably. Overall, she is a good ship.

Surcouf.evaluation: Surcouf is a damage-oriented SS with bad stats and skills. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

South Dakota.evaluation: South Dakota is a support-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. She can redirect damage dealt to the Main Fleet to herself, but that has very niche usage, and generally isn't worth using her for, over an option that can outdamage the enemy instead. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

Z2.evaluation: Z2 is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

U-47.evaluation: U-47 is a damage-oriented SS with great stats and skills. Ignore her "Lone Wolf" skill. She has great damage, especially against single-target enemies, due to her Skill 1. She also has no faction restrictions or requirements like some other SS. Overall, she is a great ship.

Suffolk.evaluation: Suffolk (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CA with meh stats and skills. She has great damage for an Elite ship, but her bulk is very frail, even with her self heal. Her Augment module is an improvement over the default Augment modules, but doesn't improve her enough to be viable. Collection only.

Mogami.evaluation: Mogami (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good due to MGM+1 CA guns, as well as her self-buffs. Her Augment module adds to her bulk, making her pretty tanky for an off-tank. Overall, she is a great ship.

Victorious.evaluation: Victorious is a damage-oriented CV with good stats and meh skills. Her personal damage is alright, but nothing special due to minor self-buffs and the unrealiability of her Skill 2. Her Reload stat is also low for a CV. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Fusou.evaluation: Fusou (Retrofit) is a flagship-oriented BB with good stats and skills. Her Augment Module makes her Retrofit more viable, due to her barrage being good. Her personal damage is decent due to good self-buffs and stats, especially for a lower rarity ship. The cost to get this investment can be a bit steep, however. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Takao.evaluation: Takao is a mob-tank oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is decent, thanks to her Augment Module granting her a barrage every 10s that is good. In addition, her bulk is also good due to her high luck and +EVA Rate from her AoA. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

McCall.evaluation: McCall is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Shangri-La.evaluation: Shangri-La is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very good due to her damage ramping self-buffs, as well as an on-strike barrage (which is unfortunately RNG). Overall, she is a great ship.

Z1.evaluation: Z1 is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her buffs are only for KMS DDs, which makes them very niche. Her personal damage is alright, but nothing special. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade/downgrade to more easily accessible options.

Fortune.evaluation: Fortune (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only

Königsberg.evaluation: Königsberg is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

King George V.evaluation: King George V is a flagship damage-oriented BB with good stats and skills. Her barrage is timed, which gives her more spread out damage when mobbing. Using the <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Quadruple_356mm_Main_Gun_Mount" title="Quadruple 356mm Main Gun Mount" >Quadruple 356mm Main Gun Mount</a > gives her an almost preload, but is not recommended due to the gun being awful otherwise. Her Augment Module removes this requirement in exchange for losing her self-buffs when sortied with Royal Navy ships, which is an alright tradeoff but nothing special. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.
King George V.preload: 75% 1st Salvo Cooldown Reduction (No other HMS ships OR equipping Quadruple 356mm).

Z18.evaluation: Z18 is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Ping Hai.evaluation: Ping Hai (Retrofit) is a tank-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her bulk when paired with Yat Sen is exceptional; one of the highest in the game. Their AoA becomes both aimed and can ignore shields, which is a great buff. Her personal damage becomes even better when sortied with Yat Sen; however, she loses a lot of bulk as a tradeoff. Overall, she is a great ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Ning Hai.evaluation: Ning Hai (Retrofit) is a tank-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her bulk when paired with Yat Sen is exceptional; one of the highest in the game. Their AoA becomes both aimed and can ignore shields, which is a great buff. Her personal damage becomes even better when sortied with Yat Sen; however, she loses a lot of bulk as a tradeoff. Overall, she is a great ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Nicholas.evaluation: Nicholas (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and great skills. Her personal damage is good due to having good FP and a lot of self-buffs, but only 1 MGM and lackluster barrages hurt her potential. Her bulk is nothing special as well. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Dido.evaluation: Dido is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and great skills. Her personal damage is amazing when sortied with at least 1 other HMS ship, due to her AoA barrage being very strong and self-buffs. Her Skill 2 can buff Queen Elizabeth or Queen Elizabeth META, but this isn't required for her to be good. With her Augment, she herself can get those buffs and increased Main Gun CRIT Rate, but since her Main Gun damage is not that massive, it isn't necessary for her to be viable. Her Augment also drastically increases her AoA damage. Overall, she is a great ship.

I-19.evaluation: I-19 is a damage-oriented SS with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is high, due to having a high TRP stat, as well as multiple barrages that enable torpedo pierce. However, her mounts having imbalanced efficiencies can hurt her consistency if torpedoes whiff. Her Skill 2 decreasing torpedo speed is very good when using magnetic torpedoes. Overall, she is a good ship.

Sendai.evaluation: Sendai (Retrofit) is a support-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her Skill 1 buffs the TRP stat of all DDs and CLs in your fleet, which is a solid boost. In addition, it significantly increases her survaviblity with her Augment Module. Her Skill 2 flares are practically useless, as they are both RNG and are hard to sync with other ships, despite the effect being very good. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Le Mars.evaluation: Le Mars (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Her Skill 1 is very RNG, and building fleets around FFNF or MNF Vanguard Ships is worse than using a union of multiple good ships. The barrage from Skill 1 is a nice bit of damage, but not enough to justify her slot in the fleet. Her Skill 2 is even more RNG than her Skill 1, and only adds to her middling bulk. Collection only.

Comet.evaluation: Comet (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Her Skill 1 barrage is servicable, but that's her only form of damage, making her overall damage mediocre. Her torpedo buff to other DDs is nice, but not that important. Her Skill 2 smokescreen is unreliable due to how smokescreens work. Overall, she is a mediocre ship.

North Carolina.evaluation: North Carolina is a support-oriented BB with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is very mediocre due to no self-buffs, and a mediocre barrage from her augment-improved Skill 1. Her Augment Module grants her a 5% HP heal to all Vanguard Fleet ships every 10s whenever she fires a Timed Fuze AA Gun, drastically increasing her support value. Even so, she still cannot solo sustain a full fleet in difficult content. Overall, she is a good ship, but worse than <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Unicorn" title="Unicorn" >Unicorn (Retrofit)</a > for general use.

Scharnhorst.evaluation: Scharnhorst is a damage-oriented BB with bad stats and skills. Her Augment Module duplicates her barrage but with your flagship's scaling, which doesn't add enough to make her relevant. Collection only.

San Diego.evaluation: San Diego (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented AND AA-oriented CL with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high with MGM+1 DD Guns and great barrages (Skill 1 with Augment, Skill 2, and AoA). In particular, her Skill 1 barrage can ignore shields and is triggered individually per Main Gun, making its frequency very fast. You always want to equip her with a fast-firing and high damage DD Gun; never give her a CL gun. In addition, her ASW stat is one of the highest amongst vanguard ships, allowing her to act as a ASW carry. Her AA stat is very high, and when paired with her Skill 1 and very high AA gun efficiency, allows her to act as an AA carry for the fleet. Her bulk is also solid as well, especially with her Augment Module skill. Overall, she is an amazing ship, if a bit expensive to max fully.

Le Malin.evaluation: Le Malin is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is fine, but nothing spectacular with only 1 MGM and a good AoA. Her Skill 1 gives a great debuff, but the activation condition is hard to achieve before the enemy dies, and the duration of the debuff is low too. The barrage that it triggers is good, but nothing amazing as well. The stack based on killing enemies is also hard to achieve, since the other 5 ships in the fleet can easily kill steal from her. Her Skill 2 is basically useless since it debuffs her as the battle goes on. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade / downgrade to other easily-accessible options.

Jamaica.evaluation: Jamaica is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skill. Collection only.

Spence.evaluation: Spence is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and a good skill. Her Skill 1 barrage is good, but it isn't enough to save her. Collection only.

Centaur.evaluation: Centaur is a support-oriented CVL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good with 8 planes. Her reload stat is on the higher end for CVs, allowing her support to be easily syncable without much effort. Her Skill 1 barrage applies a slow to enemies hit, and her Skill 2 buffs your Main Fleet. She is ideally sortied with 2 more HMS ships, but that is not necessary for her to be good. Overall, she is a great ship.

Leipzig.evaluation: Leipzig (Retrofit) is a support-oriented CL with good damage and skills. Her personal damage is good, despite only 1 MGM, due to her self buffs, good Torpedoes and the Skill 1 barrage. Her support is also good, but only works on CB / CA / CLs. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade / downgrade to other easily accessible options.

Long Island.evaluation: Long Island (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CVL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

U-96.evaluation: U-96 is a damage / support oriented SS with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great, especially with her self-buffs to TRP and TRP Crit Rate. She should be sortied in a full SS fleet due to her Skill 1 improving her barrage. Her Skill 2 both buffs other KMS SS and self-buffs herself, incentivizing her to be played in a Wolfpack SS fleet. Overall, she is a great ship, best used in a KMS Wolfpack SS fleet.

Exeter.evaluation: Exeter (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CA with good stats and meh skills. Her personal damage is good, especially against Medium Armor, due to her barrage and self-buffs. However, only 1 MGM drags her personal damage down. Her Skill 1 procs at the start of the battle and has a decent barrage attached to it, but only has a 60% trigger rate for the rest of the battle, which isn't good enough since it's uptime isn't long enough to justify the RNG involved. Her Skill 2 is nice, but also has an unreliable trigger rate. Overall, she is a meh ship, and can be a sidegrade / downgrade to other easily accessible options.

Dunkerque.evaluation: Dunkerque is a flagship-oriented BC with meh stats and good skills. Her stats are mediocre, and she has a preloaded Main Gun Mount in exchange for only having MGM+1, which isn't a good enough tradeoff. Her Skill 1 is great, but only a 70% chance for the effects to trigger hurts her. Overall, she is a meh ship, and is a sidegrade / downgrade to other easily accessible options.

Shiranui.evaluation: Shiranui is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Her Augment Module barrage adds some damage but it is not enough. Collection only.

Baltimore.evaluation: Baltimore is a damage-oriented CA with great stats and skills. She modifies her ammo type, so she prefers guns with the highest raw damage. Can be sortied with or without USS carriers. Her personal damage is also good. Overall, she is a great ship.

Alabama.evaluation: Alabama is a flagship-oriented BB with good stats and skills. Her barrage is good, and it is timed, allowing her to stagger her damage more easily. She is best used in a mobbing fleet due to her gaining more buffs as the sortie progresses. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Cavalla.evaluation: Cavalla is a damage-oriented SS with good stats and skills. She prefers to be paired with <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Albacore" title="Albacore" >Albacore</a > and/or <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Archerfish" title="Archerfish" >Archerfish</a > for best results. Her personal damage is also pretty good. Overall, she is a good SS.

Allen M. Sumner.evaluation: Allen M. Sumner is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. She has higher AA than most ships, but it is not AA-carry level. She has great damage due to her stats, efficiencies, and barrages, giving her a well-rounded kit suitable for any fleet. Overall, she is a great ship.

Birmingham.evaluation: Birmingham is a damage-oriented CL with good stats and skills. She is relatively bulky for her hull type, and she has good damage to go along with it. Her Skill 1 even offers minor fleet support due to reducing flagship Burn duration. Overall, she is a good ship.

Stephen Potter.evaluation: Stephen Potter is a support-oriented DD with meh stats and great skills. Her personal damage is pretty awful, but her skills more than make up for it. Her Skill 1 gives both other Vanguard ships a great buff, and her Skill 2 gives all CVs a Damage buff of their own. Overall, she is a good ship.

Bataan.evaluation: Bataan is a damage-oriented CVL with good stats and skills. She has high efficiency planes, and a solid barrage, but only 6 total planes hinder her. Overall, she is a good ship, but is outclassed by easily accessible options. Gives +1 CV RLD Fleet Technology.

San Juan.evaluation: San Juan is an AA-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. She has great AA, but it is not enough to justify using her over a damage option (to outdamage the enemy before their planes kill you). Collection only.

Aylwin.evaluation: Aylwin is a damage-oriented DD with really bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Formidable.evaluation: Formidable is a support / damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. As a support, she offers a timestop that other ships can take advantage of to improve their geometric accuracy against bosses. As a damage-dealer, when equipped with the <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Fairey_Albacore" title="Fairey Albacore" >Fairey Albacore</a > Torpedo Bomber, she has great screen-wide barrages on airstrike, which along with her loadout help clear out enemy waves well. Overall, she is a great ship.

Pola.evaluation: Pola is a mob-tank oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to MGM+1 CA guns, plus her skill barrages. Her bulk is also good for mobbing due to her self-buffs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Zara.evaluation: Zara is a mob-tank oriented CA with great stats and good skills. Her personal damage is mediocre since outside of her MGM+1 she has no good skill barrages. Her bulk is decent due to her shields, and her unique Augment Module further giving her evasion and minor healing. Her Skill 2 doesn't affect her Main Gun choices against enemies. Overall, she is a good ship.

Giulio Cesare.evaluation: Giulio Cesare is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with bad stats and skills. Collection only. Gives +1 BB ACC Fleet Technology.

Carabiniere.evaluation: Carabiniere is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is mediocre, and her support, while nice, is not worth using her over options that do more damage. Collection only.

Vincenzo Gioberti.evaluation: Vincenzo Gioberti is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Conte di Cavour.evaluation: Conte di Cavour is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with bad stats and skills. Her unique Augment Module is an improvement over her base form, but it is not enough to save her. Collection only. Gives +1 BB RLD Fleet Technology.

Trento.evaluation: Trento is a damage-oriented CA with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Akagi μ.evaluation: Akagi μ is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her first-strike cooldown reduction allows her to be offset from traditional BBs and CVs. She is ideally sortied with other μ ships for her self-buffs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Gascogne μ.evaluation: Gascogne μ is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and meh skills. Due to her ammo changing abilities, you want to equip a BB gun with high raw damage. Her barrages are meh, and her ammo change doesn't allow her to specialize for bosses. Only MGM+1 hurts her damage output compared to other BBs. Her first shot cooldown reduction is nice for desyncing, but not relevant for bosses. Overall she is a good ship.

Admiral Hipper μ.evaluation: Admiral Hipper μ is a tank-oriented CA with good stats but bad skills. Her bulk is good, but her bad personal damage doesn't justify using her over other options. Collection only.

Cleveland μ.evaluation: Cleveland μ is a damage-oriented CL with meh stats and bad skills. The ammo change to μ Purple actively hinders her damage output, since the armor modifiers are worse than typical CL HE guns. In addition, she lacks any self-buffs to damaging stats. Collection only.

Sheffield μ.evaluation: Sheffield μ is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Noshiro.evaluation: Noshiro is a mob-tank oriented CL with solid stats and great skills. Her personal damage (Main gun + Torpedo + Barrage) is solid. Her blue skill improves her survivability, and her yellow skill provides one of the best torpedo buffs to your fleet. Overall, she is a great option, best used as a torpedo-buffer / mob-tank.

Ryuuhou.evaluation: Ryuuhou is a healer-oriented CVL with average stats and good skills. Compared to Perseus and Unicorn (Retrofit), Ryuuhou is better when healing a single-target, but worse at fleet-wide healing. Also compared to Perseus and Unicorn, she doesn't have a preload. Overall good, but not worth using over Unicorn (Retrofit) / Perseus.

Suruga.evaluation: Suruga is a flagship-oriented BB with average stats, skills, barrage, and efficiencies. Her timed barrage means that her damage output is staggered. The barrage isn't special due to its pattern and subpar base damage. Overall, she is average, especially in the current landscape of BBs from research and recent new events.

Kazagumo.evaluation: Kazagumo is a support-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her torpedo damage is pretty good, which along with her AoA and torpedo reload reduction make her damage output on the higher end for supports. She prefers to use a fast main gun to get as many All-out-Assault activations as possible. Her CV support is top-notch; her CV/CVL heal is nice in extended fights. Overall, she is a great option.

Kinu.evaluation: Kinu (Retrofit) is a good damage-oriented CL, with solid stats and efficiencies. Skills also buff her damage output nicely. Overall, not the best, but certainly not the worst.

Kasumi (Venus Vacation).evaluation: Kasumi (DoA) is a tank-oriented CA with good stats and great skills. Her damage is below average for a tank, but her bulk is amazing to compensate. You want to use magnetic torpedoes to help proc her Skill 1. Her augment greatly improves her tank ability. Overall, she is a great ship.

Hibiki.evaluation: Hibiki doesn't have any relevant stat buffs from her skills to make up for her subpar base stats, and her self heal doesn't add much to her bulk. Collection only.

Shirayuki.evaluation: Shirayuki has FP and TRP boosts from skills, but stats and efficiencies are underwhelming compared to others. Collection only.

Sovetskaya Rossiya.evaluation: Rossiya is a flagship-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her self-buff is only for the first 2 battles, which is not relevant when mobbing. Her barrage has high raw damage but a really bad pattern and average proc rate. Overall, she is a meh ship.

Chapayev.evaluation: Chapayev is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good with MGM+1, her barrages, and her self-buffs. Her Skill 1 gives a vanguard-wide damage buff to enemies hit by her barrage, but the barrage is not guaranteed, and the buff is short. Her Skill 2 increases her damage against DDs specifically by a large amount, but it is not near the top of all CLs despite the buffs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Tashkent.evaluation: Tashkent is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good against Light Armor enemies and mobbing despite having 1 MGM, due to her summon and her barrage. Her Skill 1 summon is a decent part of her overall damage output, and also slows enemies hit which is a nice bonus. Her Augment Module doubles her summons duration and damage, which are massive buffs to her personal damage. Her torpedo damage is pretty bad, limiting her potential against Medium and Heavy armor enemies. Overall, she is a great ship.

Avrora.evaluation: Avrora is a support-oriented CL with meh stats and great skills. Her stats and personal damage are mediocre (even with her Unique Augment Module added barrage), but her buff makes up for it by buffing your Vanguard Fleet's damage. Overall, she is a great ship provided her buff is fully utilized.

Gangut.evaluation: Gangut is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. When equipped with her signiture Main Gun, she gains cooldown reduction which is nice when mobbing but still worse than other easily accessible options. Against bosses, she is also outclassed by other easily accessible options. Collection only.

Grozny.evaluation: Grozny is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Minsk.evaluation: Minsk is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Intrepid.evaluation: Intrepid is a damage-oriented CV with good stats and skills. She has a good loadout (8 planes) and an on-strike barrage; however, the barrage is nothing special compared to other recently released CVs in 2023. She also doesn't have as many self-buffs compared to the top of her hull. Overall, she is a good ship.

Reno.evaluation: Reno is an AA-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Her AA output is really high, but not good enough to AA carry. Her personal damage and bulk are both average at best. Collection only.

Bremerton.evaluation: Bremerton is a mob-tank oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her bulk is good enough to mob-tank most content due to her self-buffs. Her personal damage is also good due to her Skill 1 as well. Overall, she is a great ship.

Ingraham.evaluation: Ingraham is a support-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good, but not amazing. Her support is also good at keeping your Vanguard Fleet healthy. Her AA is good, but not enough to AA carry an entire fleet. There is no need to focus +TRP auxiliary equipment to increase her AA self-buff. Overall, she is a good ship.

Cooper.evaluation: Cooper attempts to be an ASW-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Nautilus.evaluation: Nautilus is a damage-oriented SS with great stats and skills. Her gimmick of resurfacing for a bit before diving back against is not useful, and can make her die earlier than expected. However, her personal damage is still pretty good, making her worth using as a 3rd SS in a USS composition, assuming you have nobody better. Overall, she is a good ship.

Bluegill.evaluation: Bluegill is a SS with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Casablanca.evaluation: Casablanca is a support-oriented CVL with meh stats and great skills. Her personal damage is really bad; however she does have fast airstrikes to help mitigate it. Her fleet support for other CV / CVLs is really good, however. Overall, she is a good ship; outclassed by <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Independence" title="Independence" >Independence (Retrofit)</a >.

Marblehead.evaluation: Marblehead is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Ark Royal.evaluation: Ark Royal (Retrofit) is a support-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is really high, even without her skill proc, against single target enemies. Her slow support can help all members of your fleet land their shots / airstrikes precisely. Overall, she is a great ship.

Jeanne d'Arc.evaluation: Jeanne d'Arc is a support-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very mediocre at best, but she makes up for it with her Vanguard Fleet supportive capabilities. Against most bosses, her prescence can increase the survaviblity of your Vanguard Fleet by a sizable amount. Overall, she is a great ship.

Richelieu.evaluation: Richelieu is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. She buffs all French ships in your fleet, however she is fine without buffing anyone but herself. Her barrage is alright, and her preload helps frontload her damage output. Only MGM+1 hurts her in longer fights. Overall, she is a great ship.

Le Terrible.evaluation: Le Terrible is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her damage is good due to her multiple skill barrages and self-buffs. She is ideally sortied as the only DD in your vanguard for the RLD and DMG reduction buffs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Béarn.evaluation: Béarn is a damage-oriented CVL with meh stats and skills. Can equip a secondary gun, which helps with interception. Collection only.
Béarn.preload: 50% 1st Airstrike Cooldown Reduction (Dive Bomber in Slot 3).

La Galissonnière.evaluation: La Galissonnière is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Maillé Brézé.evaluation: Maillé Brézé is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Vauquelin.evaluation: Vauquelin is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Foch.evaluation: Foch is a damage-oriented CA with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Howe.evaluation: Howe is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. She has a 100% chance timed barrage that does decent damage, while also providing minor RLD support to herself and other BB/BC/BBVs. She is ideally sortied to make full use of her Skill 2 self-buffs; however, that is not fully necessary for her to be good. Overall, she is a great ship.

Perseus.evaluation: Perseus is a healer oriented CVL with meh stats and great skills. Her damage is heavily frontloaded due to 2 preloaded airstrikes at the start of the battle. Her personal damage is really bad due to low efficiencies, AVI stat, and 6 planes. In addition, she contributes nothing else to the battle outside of her frontloaded damage and healing due to her airstrikes taking almost twice as long as other CVLs. However, her healing is really good, and heals both the Vanguard and Main Fleets. Her Skill 2 barrage does not have enough damage to subvert her deficiencies. Overall, she is an amazing healer, but redundant due to the existance of Unicorn (Retrofit).

Hermione.evaluation: Hermione is a damage-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is mediocre due to 1 MGM and decent barrages. self-buffs. She ideally is not sortied as the Main Tank due to her Skill 2 self-buffs. Overall, she is a mediocre ship. Collection only.

Eagle.evaluation: Eagle is a damage-oriented CVL with meh stats and skills. Can equip a secondary gun, which helps with interception. Collection only.
Eagle.preload: 50% 1st Airstrike Cooldown Reduction (Dive Bomber in Slot 3).

Valiant.evaluation: Valiant is a damage-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is mediocre due to a 50% barrage chance, and average Main Gun efficiencies and stats. She offers some fleet support due to a spoecial Armor Break, but that is not worth using her over a better ship that contributes more to the battle. Collection only.

Icarus.evaluation: Icarus is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Shinano.evaluation: Shinano is an damage-oriented CV with 9 planes, great loadout, high stats/efficiencies, and great skills. She ideally is sortied with 2 other IJN ships for her self-buffs. Her debuffs to enemies are nice as fleet support. Overall, she is an amazing ship, and can fit in any fleet very well.

Kii.evaluation: Kii is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her timed barrage means that her damage output is staggered. She is ideally sortied with 2 other IJN ships for her buffs. Uniquely, she also buffs the Torpedo stat from the Main Fleet, however that has situational usage. Overall she is a great ship.

Suzutsuki.evaluation: Suzutsuki is a damage-oriented DD with great stats, skills, and barrages, and solid efficiencies. She has MGM+1, alongside solid Torpedo stat/efficiency, giving her great mixed damage. Her self-heal adds to her bulk as well. Smokescreen is a bit situational, but is always nice when it works. Overall she is a great ship.

Kashino.evaluation: Has solid bulk, but lack of damage output hurts her a lot. Her potential support capabiliities from Cargo gear are also lackluster. Collection only.

Chiyoda.evaluation: She has subpar stats and unreliable skills, along with only 6 planes. Collection only. Gives +1 CV RLD Fleet Technology.

Chitose.evaluation: She has subpar stats and unreliable skills, along with only 6 planes. Collection only. Gives +1 CV AVI Fleet Technology.

Dido μ.evaluation: Dido μ is an AA-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her AA is really high, but not enough to act as an AA carry. Her personal damage is good due to her skill barrages. Overall, she is a good ship.

Illustrious μ.evaluation: Illustrious μ is a damage-oriented CV with good stats and skills. Her damage is heavily skewed towards Light and Medium armor due to possessing 6 Fighters and a Rocket skill barrage. Her support is nice, but unreliable due to the random chance involved. Overall, she is a good ship.

Le Malin μ.evaluation: Le Malin μ is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to multiple, reliable skill barrages. Her bulk is also pretty good due to multiple self-buffs and small heals throughout her kit. Overall, she is a good ship.

Roon μ.evaluation: Roon μ is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is really good due to MGM+1 CA guns and good skill barrages. Her support is a bit unreliable due to its awkward timing and pattern, but it is nice to have. Overall, she is a great ship.

Taihou μ.evaluation: Taihou μ is a damage-oriented CV with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to multiple skill barrages; however her reliance on other μ ships for self-buffs hinders her damage potential. Overall, she is a good ship.

Tashkent μ.evaluation: Tashkent μ is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good due to multiple skill barrages, and her summon makes up for only having 1 MGM. Her self-buffs are pretty bad outside of the summon, however. Overall, she is a good ship

Albacore μ.evaluation: Albacore μ is a damage-oriented SS with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Baltimore μ.evaluation: Baltimore μ is a damage-oriented CA with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is mediocre due to a lack of good self-buffs, and she doesn't have any relevant fleet-wide support. Collection only.

Princeton.evaluation: Princeton is a damage-oriented CVL with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Peter Strasser.evaluation: Peter Strasser is a damage-oriented CV with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is solid due to good stats and an on-strike barrage, but it is nothing exceptional. Her chance to set enemy speed to 0 is too random to take advantage of, but it is nice to have. She is ideally sortied with other KMS CVs to take advantage of the cooldown reduction she provides. Overall, she is a good ship.

Prinz Heinrich.evaluation: Prinz Heinrich is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to her skill barrages and high FP stat and efficiencies. She can equip the Triple 283mm CB gun to help deal with shielded enemies. Her bulk is also good enough to Main Tank most content in the game. Overall, she is a great ship.

U-37.evaluation: U-37 is a damage-oriented SS with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is among the top of SS, and her reload requirements allow her to equip a Mark 20 "Bidder" without needing a Snorkel. In addition, she also gains self-buffs when paired with other KMS SS. Overall, she is an amazing SS option.

Nürnberg.evaluation: Nürnberg is an AA-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Her AA is good but not high enough to AA carry as a dedicated AA unit. Her personal damage is bad, and her SS EXP buff is situational at best, since calling in SS is unreliable on auto-battle. Overall, she is a meh ship.

Weser.evaluation: Weser is a damage-oriented CVL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Z24.evaluation: Z24 is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Z28.evaluation: Z28 is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Chao Ho.evaluation: Chao Hao is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Her lack of an AA Gun Mount, forcing her to use her Ghost AA Gun, actively hurts your fleet's AA capabilities. Collection only.

Ying Swei.evaluation: Ying Swei is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Her lack of an AA Gun Mount, forcing her to use her Ghost AA Gun, actively hurts your fleet's AA capabilities. Collection only.

Penelope.evaluation: Penelope is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

U-410.evaluation: U-410 is a damage-oriented SS with meh stats and skills. Her damage in KMS Submarine Fleets is alright, but worse than all the gold ships. Collection only.

Fu Shun.evaluation: Fu Shun is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Kirov.evaluation: Kirov is a damage-oriented CL with good stats and great skills. Her personal damage is pretty good due to multiple skill barrages and her increased Main Gun range. Her bulk is also decent. Overall, she is a good ship.

Sovetskaya Belorussiya.evaluation: Sovetskaya Belorussiya is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her barrage is strong, and has a good pattern; although, it is a bit farther back than normal. She also has multiple heals for self-sutain over the course of fights, and even helps your Vanguard Fleet a little bit as well. Overall, she is a great ship.

Tallinn.evaluation: Tallinn is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is alright due to her self-buffs and barrages, but it is still on the lower end of tank damage. Her bulk is really high due to her stats and barrier, enabling her to Main Tank any content with no issues. She is ideally equipped with a Northern Parliament or Iron Blood Main Gun for her skill. Overall, she is a great ship.

Gremyashchy.evaluation: Gremyashchy is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Gromky.evaluation: Gromky is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Murmansk.evaluation: Murmansk is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Pamiat' Merkuria.evaluation: Pamiat' Merkuria is a tank-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is decent due to MGM+1 DD guns and a solid barrage. Her bulk is really high, especially when RNG rolls her way. Due to the RNG nature of her bulk, her tanking ability, esepcially when bossing, can be in doubt. Overall, she is a great ship.

Aquila.evaluation: Aquila is a damage / support oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her per-strike damage is good due to her 8 plane loadout and on-strike barrage. Depending on the equip in her 2nd slot, she can change modes between damage and support. In damage mode, she gains a preload and multiple offensive buffs. In support mode, she grants healing and shield support for the fleet. Overall, she is a great ship regardless of what mode she is in.

Duca degli Abruzzi.evaluation: Duca degli Abruzzi is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very balanced due to decent Main Guns, barrages, and her great torpedo damage. Her bulk is also pretty good as well due to her stats, and her Skill 2 adds to it further. Overall, she is a great ship.

Vittorio Veneto.evaluation: Vittorio Veneto is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is high due to multiple self-buffs, good efficiencies, and a great timed barrage. She can reduce her first Main Gun salvo based on the number of other RN ships in the fleet, but that is not necessary for her to be good. The buff from using AP Guns or having RN ships from her Skill 3 is nice, but not necessary for her to be good. Overall, she is a great ship.
Vittorio Veneto.preload: 80% 1st Salvo Cooldown Reduction (+40% per additional RN ship, max 80%).

Libeccio.evaluation: Libeccio is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Maestrale.evaluation: Maestrale is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Nicoloso da Recco.evaluation: Nicoloso da Recco is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Torricelli.evaluation: Torricelli is a damage-oriented SS with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

New Jersey.evaluation: New Jersey is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with amazing stats and skills. Her shelling damage is really high, and combined with a great barrage makes her personal damage really high. Her self-buffs (especially the Main Gun Spread reduction) are also really good, further boosting her damage. Her crossfleet skill barrage is nice, and the buff is good when using USS CVs in the other fleet. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

San Francisco.evaluation: San Francisco is a versatile CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good due to her stats, barrages, and MGM+1, and it is further amplified when in the Off-Tank position. As a Main Tank, she gains damage reduction to further amplify her bulk. In the Middle position, she gives your Vanguard a heal once per battle. As an Off-Tank, she further amplifies the damage your Vanguard Fleet does. Overall, she is a great ship, regardless of which mode she is in.

Ticonderoga.evaluation: Ticonderoga is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is pretty good due to 8 planes and an on-strike barrage that can inflict DoT. She also has great bulk with damage mitigation for her first few instances of damage taken, as well as a small shield for your Vanguard. Overall, she is a great ship.

Boise.evaluation: Boise is a damage-oriented CL with average stats and skills. Her personal damage is good with MGM+1 CL guns and a barrage. Her self-buffs are nothing special, however. Overall, she is an alright ship.

Morrison.evaluation: Morrison is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Independence.evaluation: Independence (Retrofit) is a support-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is really good due to an 8 plane loadaout and an on-strike barrage. She also buffs CVs both inside and outside of your fleet, and gets a self-cooldown reduction on her first airstrike. Overall, she is an amazing CV.

Shimakaze.evaluation: Shimakaze is a damage-oriented DD with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is really high due to her high torpedo stat, high efficiencies, great self buffs and enemy resistence shread, and multiple good barrages. Since her Main Gun damage is bad, you want to run a very high reload Main Gun on her to maximize her barrage damage. Her bulk is fine, but not the greatest. Her crossfleet support is nice as well, but not required to make her worth using. Overall, she is an amazing DD.

Chikuma.evaluation: Chikuma is a tank-oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her bulk is really high due to her self buff granting her +EVA Rate whenever her skill conditions activate. Her personal damage is meh due to only 1 MGM and middling barrages. Her support is also lackluster, with the AVI damage taken debuff being RNG reliant. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Katsuragi.evaluation: Katsuragi is a damage-oriented CV with good stats and skills. She has a full 8-plane CV loadout along with good plane efficiencies, making her damage good. Her barrage is very pretty, but each individual petal does a small amount of damage, and the main part of the barrage damage is converging torpedoes, which has an unreliable hit-rate. Her AVI damage reduction support is good, but very situational given that it requires an IJN fleet. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Umikaze.evaluation: Umikaze is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Yamakaze.evaluation: Yamakaze is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Yura.evaluation: Yura is a support-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage and support have contridicting requirements, forcing you to choose one or the other. Both modes are subpar anyway, making her not worth using. Collection only.

Yuudachi.evaluation: Yuudachi (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high due to MGM+1 DD Guns, high torpedo stat and efficiency, and great self-buffs. In addition, she does more damage to burned enemies, and her barrage applies burns, allowing her kit to be maximized without supports. Her bulk is also high due to her Skill 3 self-buffs as well. Her support is nice, but buffing other ships is not needed to make her worth using. Overall, she is an amazing DD.

Ulrich von Hutten.evaluation: Ulrich von Hutten is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high due to great shelling damage along with her self-buffs. When she is placed off-flag, she fires twice as fast, but deals less damage per volley; overall, this is a slight increase from using her at Flagship, due to more overall damage percent and more barrage procs. Her barrage is nice, but it is not worth to sync the slow it provides with anything. Her buff when equipped with an HE Main Gun is nice, but AP is still preferred against Medium/Heavy armored enemies. Her crossfleet is very nice defense for your other fleets, but is not necessary for her to be good. Overall, she is an amazing BB.

Magdeburg.evaluation: Magdeburg is a damage-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is middling due to only 1 MGM. Her barrage can make it better, but it requires winning 2 battles to improve it to a good level. Her self-buffs are also reliant on winning battles throughout the sortie. Her bulk is fine; nothing special but not awful either. Her AA is fine; nothing special. Overall, she is a good CL.

Prinz Adalbert.evaluation: Prinz Adalbert is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to her skill barrages and high FP stat and efficiencies. She can equip the Triple 283mm CB gun to help deal with shielded enemies. Her bulk is also good enough to Main Tank most content in the game. Her Skill 2 can also redirect damage that was intended for other Vanguard ships, making her have utility even outside of the Main Tank position. Overall, she is a great ship.

Elbe.evaluation: Elbe is a damage-oriented CVL with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is middling due to 6 planes. Her airstrike barrage is not 100% proc chance and also middling. The shield she provides is not worth using her for. Collection only.

U-1206.evaluation: U-1206 is a damage-oriented SS with meh stats and skills. You would only use her as a transitional KMS submarine while you are trying to build the better KMS submarines. Collection only.

event.name: Joint Battle Mystery Investigation (Lunar New Year 2022)

Bristol.evaluation: Bristol is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is alright despite 1 MGM, since her barrages are good and she has AoA reduction. Her AA is also good, due to having a relatively high AA stat and efficiencies compared to other DDs. Her lanturn debuff is amazing if it lands, but due to the zone spawing in front of Bristol, it is unreliable to trigger on auto-battle. Overall, she is a good ship.

event.name: Joint Battle Mystery Investigation (Lunar New Year 2022)

Charybdis.evaluation: Charybdis is a support-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is bad due to only 1 MGM and bad barrages. Her AA damage is good, but nothing special. Her Skill 1 whirlpool is very underwhelming and has a small AoE. Collection only.

event.name: Joint Battle Mystery Investigation (Lunar New Year 2022)

Hai Chi.evaluation: Hai Chi is a damage-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is alright due to MGM+1 DD Guns. Her smokescreen is unreliable on auto-battle due to your Vanguard Fleet moving in and out of it repeatedly. Her lack of an AA Gun Mount actively hurts your fleets AA output. Collection only.

event.name: Joint Battle Mystery Investigation (Lunar New Year 2022)

Hai Tien.evaluation: Hai Tien is a damage-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is alright due to MGM+1 DD Guns and decent barrages. However, her lack of an AA Gun Mount actively hurts your fleets AA output. Collection only.

event.name: Joint Battle Mystery Investigation (Lunar New Year 2022)

An Shan.evaluation: An Shan (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is amazing due to great self-buffs, MGM+1 DD Guns, a Missile, and multiple good barrages. Never use her in Main Fleet Mode; Vanguard Fleet Mode is a lot better for her self-damage. The Missile Strike is nice, but is not necessary for her viability. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

event.name: Joint Battle Mystery Investigation (Lunar New Year 2022)

Chang Chun.evaluation: Chang Chun (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is amazing due to great self-buffs, MGM+1 DD Guns, a Missile, and multiple good barrages. Never use her in Main Fleet Mode; Vanguard Fleet Mode is a lot better for her self-damage. Her buff to other Dragon Empery and Northern Parliament ships is nice, but not necessary for her viability. The Missile Strike is nice, but is not necessary for her viability. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Kronshtadt.evaluation: Kronshtadt is a tank-oriented CB with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is high due to MGM+1 CB Guns, as well as multiple skill barrages. She should be equipping a high-caliber Main Gun for faster Skill 1 barrages. She should also be equipping a Northern Parliament equipment to massively increase her secondary gun damage. Her bulk is also very high as well due to her raw stats, as well as minor buffs from her Skill 2 and Skill 3 further augmenting it. Her crossfleet is also nice, but not necessary for her viability. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Kiev.evaluation: Kiev is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good, despite only 1 MGM, due to multiple good barrages. The Skill 1 barrage is only buffed on the 2nd and 3rd activations, making her slightly more mobbing-oriented. Her Skill 2 gives her minor self-buffs, but you will realistically never use her as a solo vanguard. Overall, she is a good ship.

Volga.evaluation: Volga is a support-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to having the full 8-plane CV loadout, and multiple barrages. She lacks a lot of self-buffs except from her Skill 3, which should be satisfied very easily. Her Skill 2 provides a lot of healing, but two out of the three heals have random targetting. Overall, she is a great ship.

Arkhangelsk.evaluation: Arkhangelsk is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her barrage is 100%, but has mediocre damage. The +ACC buff to your Main Fleet is not that useful as well. Her Skill 2 is just self-buffs, but they aren't large enough to affect her viability. Collection only.

Soobrazitelny.evaluation: Soobrazitelny is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Her Skill 1 has a smokescreen, which is very rng. Her Skill 2 is alright, but the heal is only to SN DDs, AND limited in activation chances. The Skill 2 barrage is nothing special as well. Collection only.

Impero.evaluation: Impero is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to her 8 plane loadout, and a (unfortunately not 100%) timed barrage. Her first skill gives her a reduced reload for her first airstrike when equipping a fighter, allowing her to desync with the rest of your Main Fleet. However, due to her low reload stat relative to other Main Fleet ships, she will eventually catch up after a few airstrikes. Her Dive Bomber mode is not useful due to the damage bonus only applying to 1 airstrike overall, and making her slow reload even slower. Her Skill 2 is effectively useless, as the HP is just being transferred around instead of outright healing. Overall, she is a great ship.

Pompeo Magno.evaluation: Pompeo Magno is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to MGM+1 DD Guns and good FP. Her torpedo damage is not good, and neither is her barrage damage. Her Skill 1 special burn is not that special, as it does little damage. Her Skill 2 buffs her torpedo damage, but it isn't enough to make her torpedo damage stand out. Her bulk is also decent due to gaining 30% more stats from auxiliaries. Overall, she is a good ship.

Trieste.evaluation: Trieste is a damage-oriented CA with bad stats and skills. Despite her stats being damage-oriented, her skills are bulk-oriented, making her bad at both. Collection only.

Emden.evaluation: Emden is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. She has top CL damage due to her strong barrages and guns, plus an interesting torpedo gimmick. CL gun mode has more damage, but DD gun mode has slightly less damage for solid utility. Either mode works extremely well. Bulk is average, but DD gun mode's heal helps. Overall, she is VERY good. <b >No ghost AA gun, meaning she doesn't drag your fleet down in AA heavy worlds</b >.

Lützow.evaluation: Lützow is a flagship-oriented BC, with solid stats and an alright barrage. Has a meh debuff, and is otherwise very "traditional." Overall, seems solid; nothing exceptional, but not awful. <b >No ghost AA gun, meaning she doesn't drag your fleet down in AA heavy worlds</b >.

Seydlitz.evaluation: Seydlitz is an off-flag damage-oriented BC with great stats and skills. She can off-flag if needed. You want her to have a high % of health as possible, although the damage redistribution goes against that. Main gun salvo reduction is great in mobbing, and she can give other SMS BB/BC the same reduction. Damage output is also fairly solid, making her great in bosses. Overall seems great; nothing exceptional, but she has great damage and the first salvo cooldown reduction. Typical event SSR. <b >No ghost AA gun, meaning she doesn't drag your fleet down in AA heavy worlds</b >.

Elbing.evaluation: What did you expect from a purple torpedo focused CL with meh stats, skills, and efficiencies? She's bad, just like a typical event purple. Waifu only. <b >No ghost AA gun, meaning she doesn't drag your fleet down in AA heavy worlds</b >.

Thüringen.evaluation: Stats are meh, and barrage pattern is not that great. Debuff is alright, but still worse than other BB support like Duke of York. She's bad, but it could be worse. Waifu only. <b >No ghost AA gun, meaning she doesn't drag your fleet down in AA heavy worlds</b >.

Yorck.evaluation: Has meh bulk for a tank, but damage is lacking. Worse than Portland Kai as a tank, therefore not really worth using outside waifu. She's bad, but it could be worse. Waifu only. <b >No ghost AA gun, meaning she doesn't drag your fleet down in AA heavy worlds</b >.

Little Prinz Eugen.evaluation: Little Eugen is basically a normal Eugen sidegrade. Since normal Eugen is only tank and nothing else, Little Eugen falls into the same category. Waifu Protecc only.

Vanguard.evaluation: Vanguard is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with amazing stats and skills. Her AA is very high, allowing her to help the vanguard in plane-heavy areas situationally. Her debuffs are amazing, allowing the entire fleet to take advantage of them. Her personal damage is pretty good with MGM+2 BB Guns, and a good barrage, especially since she can take advantage of her own debuffs. The Secondary Gun Crit Rate buff looks nice on paper but is useless outside W14. Her crossfleet barrage + buff are nice, but not necessary for her to be good. You want to use an HMS equipment on her, which is most likely going to be <a href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Twin_40mm_Bofors_STAAG" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" title="Twin 40mm Bofors STAAG" >Twin 40mm Bofors STAAG</a >, among other great HMS Secondary Gun or AA Gun options. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Indomitable.evaluation: Indomitable is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Don't pair her with Prince of Wales or Repulse (<a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Repulse META" title="Repulse META" >Repulse META</a > is fine, but not necessary!), and ideally she is sortied without her fellow Illustrious-class sisters as well. Her 6 fighter 2 torpedo bomber loadout is very nice against light and medium armor targets when equipped with the BF-109G, and has a nice balance of damage and AA with a traditional fighter. Her Skill barrages add more free damage as well. Overall she is a great ship.

Jervis.evaluation: Jervis is a mob-tank oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her AoA barrage is good, making her damage output solid even though she only has 1 MGM. Her heal is nice, however it's not enough to support an entire fleet on its own. Her Skill 1 buffs are very situational, with the HMS support being practically useless, and the "only in DD/CL fleet" buff being W14 / W15 specific. Her Skill 2 gives her great bulk when placed in the tank position;however, with her low HP her bulk against bosses is in doubt. She also has 30% Aux stat gain which helps add to her bulk. Overall, she is a great ship.

Revenge.evaluation: Revenge is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with bad stats and skills. Her stats are bad compared to gold BBs, and the skills don't make up for them. Her Barrage is very meh, the armor break is alright but not worth sacrificing a BB slot for, and the second skill in its entirety is purely a gimmick. Collection only.

Bellona.evaluation: Bellona is a support-oriented CL with good stats and great skills. Bulk is alright, AA is pretty high but not carry level, but her damage output is mediocre. The only redeeming factor about her is the Air Raid Assistance CV buff, combined with her higher than average AA. HMS buff is not worth for the most part due to how situational and bad it is. Overall, she is good as a carrier buffer and for AA support, but not worth using outside this niche.

Unicorn.evaluation: Unicorn (Retrofit) is a healer-oriented CVL with great stats and amazing skills. She gains a preload which helps a lot with mobbing, and also gains backline healing capabilities as well. Her healing amount is also high as well. Overall, she is the best healer in the game, surpassing <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Perseus" title="Perseus" >Perseus</a >.

Little Cheshire.evaluation: Little Cheshire is an AA-oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her bulk and surface damage output are alright, and the AA output remains close to normal Cheshire. Has a self-heal skill as well. Overall she's one of the better loli ships, but outside AA heavy areas she is not useful.

Joffre.evaluation: Joffre is a solid CV with great stats and efficiencies. Barrages are great; she wants to be in the bottom position for the torpedo bomber barrage. Solid CV, worthy of being an event SR.

L'Indomptable.evaluation: L'Indomptable is a solid DD with great FP and Main Gun Efficiency. Her Torpedo Stat and Torpedo Efficiency sucks, but her skills bring them back up to respectable levels. Skill 2 is practically useless in PvE (since if ships are almost dying something has gone wrong), and is mainly for stall memeing. Barrages are solid, and work great with AoA shot reduction. Solid DD, worthy of being an event SR.

Enterprise (Royal Navy).evaluation: What did you expect from a purple torpedo focused CL with meh Stats, Skills, and Efficiencies? Her saving grace is that her AoA barrage is alright. She's bad, just like a typical event purple. Waifu only.

Roma.evaluation: Roma is a great off-flag damage-oriented BB, with great stats and skills. Barrage is solid, and doesn't require flagship position; the failed proc benefits are decent as well. She is guarenteed max critical damage/rate stacks at 30s into the battle, which is early enough to be relevant especially versus a boss. The sonar part of her skill is useless. The fast load from sortieing with 3 Italians is nice if you can fulfil the requirements, but it is not mandatory for her to be great. Overall, she is a great off-flag BB; typical event SR.

Giuseppe Garibaldi.evaluation: Giuseppe is a solid CL, with solid stats and skills. Her skills give her great self-buffs, although some expire at 60s into the battle and others only activate 20s in. Due to only 1 MGM, she is torpedo and barrage oriented for her damage output. The instant AoA when sortied with 3 Italians is nice if you can fulfil the requirements, but is not mandatory.Overall seems great, but is nothing exceptional; typical event SR

Leonardo da Vinci.evaluation: Leonardo is a great SS, with high TRP and OXY. Her OXY and RLD are high enough to use a Mark 20 "Bidder" without a Snorkel. Due to her first skill, using one of <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Twin_135mm_(Model_1938)" title="Twin 135mm (Model 1938)" >Twin 135mm (Model 1938)</a >, or <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Twin_120mm_(Model_1936)" title="Twin 120mm (Model 1936)" >Twin 120mm (Model 1936)</a > is highly recommended. Remember to check your Depot -> Craft menu as well. Her summon and barrages are nice added bonuses as well. Her third skill is situational at best, but is always nice to have. Overall, she is a very good SS, and is a great option in any Submarine Fleet.

Alfredo Oriani.evaluation: Alfredo is a bad DD with alright FP, but meh/bad other stats. Her efficiencies, coupled with only 1 MGM, make her damage output bad as well. The flares are situational at best, and so is the smokescreen. Overall, she is bad; collection only.

Bolzano.evaluation: Bolzano is a bad CA with meh/bad stats. Her skills improve her bulk a decent bit, but she is still not tanky enough to main tank most content. Her damage ouput is average at best as well. Overall, she is bad; collection only.

Emanuele Pessagno.evaluation: Emanuele Pessagno is a bad DD with alright FP, but meh/bad other stats. Her skills are decent, and her high main gun efficiency give her decent damage despite 1 MGM. The second skill is all situational at best. Overall she is bad, but it could be worse; collection only.

Brünhilde.evaluation: Brünhilde is a great off-flag BC. She has great damage output due to her solid stats and double barrages. She has multiple forms of BB support from her slow and her BB accuracy buffs as well. Her barrages are not position dependent, which is always nice to see. Ideally, she is sortied with both her self-buff skill requirements met. Overall, she is a very solid BC. Typical event SR.

Blücher.evaluation: Blücher is a great tank-oriented CA. She has great damage output from her self-buffs, barrages, and ghost guns. She also has decent bulk from her stats and skills. Due to her damage absorption, she might not tank high-damage output bosses that well; this needs more testing. Overall, she is a very solid tank. Typical event SR.

Z16.evaluation: Z16 is a mixed bag. Her stats are not high, and 1 Main Gun with subpar barrages makes her damage output meh. She boosts her AP gun damage, but has low base FP. She gains the Torpedo spread reduction Limit Break benefit, but has subpar torpedos. Her mines are a neat gimmick, but are practically useless in standard gameplay. Overall, she is collection only. Gives +1 DD FP Fleet Technology.

Charles Ausburne.evaluation: Charles Ausburne (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Since Beaver Squadron Tag is wasted on DDs compared to tank cruisers, all aspects requiring it are practically useless. Her damage got buffed from her base form, and she gained a new barrage to further improve it, but it still doesn't make her better than starter retrofits. Overall, she is a good ship.

Musashi.evaluation: Musashi is an off-flag capable BB with top tier damage and bulk. She has a guaranteed barrage on main gun fire, a variety of very strong self-buffs, and a crossfleet barrage to boot. She still prefers flagship due to barrage pattern, but can work off-flag. For the IJN Main Gun requirement, the best options are the Twin 410mm Kai (HE, no syncing), the Triple 460mm (AP, no syncing), or Triple 410mm (AP, syncing). The enhanced barrage is a sizable upgrade, but since Musashi overkills most content in a good fleet regardless, it's fine to ignore it. For the IJN gear requirement, use the Type 1 AP Shell as an Auxilary. Overall, Musashi is amazing, and is highly worth getting.

Sakawa.evaluation: Sakawa is a torpedo-oriented CL, best used as an off-tank/Mob main-tank. While she only has 1 MGM, her 2 barrages help keep her damage at respectable levels. She also has great bulk, and great potential to increase both her bulk and damage as the battle drags on. Overall, she is solid; nothing spectacular but not awful either.

Wakatsuki.evaluation: Wakatsuki is a hybrid-oriented DD best used as a middle-position damage dealer. She has solid stats with multiple barrages and MGM+1, which give her great bullet spam. She also has a secondary built-in ASW mount, which is nice in submarine-heavy areas but useless outside of that. Ignore the Akizuki-class sortie buff when using her, it is not needed at all for her to be good. Overall, she is solid; one of the best DDs currently.

Haguro.evaluation: Haguro is a tank-oriented CA best used as a main tank. She has good enough HP, which coupled with her great Luck and Evasion (which can get boosted further from her torpedoes!) gives her high bulk. She also has a self-heal when the skill barrage activation fails. Her barrages and MGM are very mediocre for the role, however. Overall, she is a great pure tank, but has bad damage output for the role.

Miyuki.evaluation: Miyuki is a torpedo-oriented DD with meh stats compared to other ships in her role. Her guns and AA aren't good, and her torpedoes and skills are not good enough to make her noticable. In particular, ramming and evasion reliant skills are huge gimmicks for low HP ships like Miyuki. Collection only.

Juneau.evaluation: Juneau (Retrofit) is an AA-oriented CL with surprisingly decent damage on the side. The retrofit doubled her surface damage output, while also increasing her AA capabilities further. She is now vastly more viable in PvE than before. Overall, she is great as an AA ship, with decent damage to go along with it.

Shropshire.evaluation: Shropshire (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CA best used as a middle-position damage dealer. The retrofit improved her damage drastically, giving her a London Retrofit-esque slot 2 and a vanguard-wide support skill. However, her bulk still remains especially frail, which can be a concern on certain stages. Overall, she is a solid option; nothing special, but not bad either.

Albion.evaluation:
Albion is a damage-oriented CVL with great stats and skills.
Positives: Her damage per strike is very high, due to both her loadout being good and the barrage being amazing. Her debuff is great as well, although targetting can be a bit wack against multiple enemies. In addition, she helps keep herself and other Main Fleet ships hidden, and reduces their burn damage, which is always nice.
Negatives': The ASW part of her skill is situational at best, and so is the overhealing shield.
Verdict': Above average damage-oriented CV; not top-tier but certainly very good.

Janus.evaluation:
Janus is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and barrages, but average skills.
Positives: Skill 2 is amazing, and when coupled with her stats and amazing barrages make her damage output (both direct and indirect) on the higher end for DDs.
Negatives': Only 1 Main Gun Mount hinders damage output a bit. Skill requirements ruin fleetbuilding. The shield benefit is nice but requires 2 other HMS ships in the fleet, and the self-buff requires her sister, which is impractical in most cases.
Verdict': Above average DD; starter level or better.

Royal Fortune.evaluation:
Royal Fortune is a Frigate (basically Submarine), that surfaces instantly and shoots guns at enemies instead of staying underwater and shooting torpedoes like normal Submarines.
Positives: Assuming she is on the field for the full 60s duration, her damage on paper vs Light/Med enemies is really strong/comparable to traditional Submarines (especially in the first 30s), and extra support in the form of the slow is always nice to see.
Negatives': Her damage against heavy armor is very mediocre/bad compared to traditional Submarines. Her bulk is also on the lower side, so how long she stays on the field in practice is to be determined.
Verdict': Top non-faction dependent submarine.

Manchester.evaluation:
Manchester is a damage-oriented CL with average FP, bad Torpedoes, and good skills.
