Positives: Both her skills are very good; boosting her self damage and faster torpedoes are great.
Negatives': Her personal damage is lackluster due to a mediocre AoA and only 1 CL Main Gun Mount. The Torpedo stat is so bad that it doesn't make up for the lack of bullet damage.
Verdict': Waifu only.

Yorktown II.evaluation: Yorktown II is an amazing CV with amazing stats and skills. She has 9 planes, and great stats and efficiencies, making her damage output about equal to the other Rainbow CVs. Due to her barrages, she is best used against Light or Medium armor enemies, but still holds up very well against Heavy overall. Her support is amazing as well, with her AA resistance decrease, and additional USS CV damage buffs on top of it. Crossfleet is always nice to have as well. For the USS plane requirement, there are a lot of great options, check out a gear guide for more information. Amazing CV, highly worth getting.

Hornet II.evaluation: Hornet II is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. There is nothing special here, it's just typical CV self-buffs and barrages, making her damage really good. She is ideally used against Light/Medium armor enemies due to her barrages. She even has a survivability bonus. Great CV, highly worth getting.

Northampton II.evaluation: Northampton is a damage/support-oriented CA. She has enough bulk to off-tank most content. She buffs other cruisers in the same fleet (inlcuding herself), and has a 50% slow when used in a fleet that has a USS CV/CVL as flagship. In addition, MGM+1 coupled with great stats and barrages make her damage really high for a CA. Great CA, highly worth getting.

Hammann II.evaluation: Hammann II is a support-oriented DD that has bad surface damage but more than makes up for it with utility. She has a CV damage buff, flagship protection, and high enough AA to keep CVs hidden most of the time. She even has a special ASW mount to buff her damage there. Bad surface damage drags her down, along with subpar bulk. Great CV buffer.

Langley II.evaluation: Langley II is a support-oriented CVL that has decent damage and great support. Due to her personal damage being mediocre, she is most likely not worth using over other damage options, despite the CV support. Decent, but you probably have something better.

Kuybyshev.evaluation: Kuybyshev is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. She has MGM+1 along with multiple decent barrages, giving her great damage. She also has decent bulk, especially when paired with another SN ship. The Northern Parliament vanguard critical damage boost, while nice, is not a game-changer in practice. Great event SSR, highly worth getting.

Theseus.evaluation: Theseus is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. She has a full 8-plane CV loadout along with great plane efficiencies, giving her good damage. In addition, she also has multiple barrages, which give her good built-in damage stagger. She also buffs her own bulk, although in most cases those effects are not relevant. Typical event SSR, not amazing but not awful either.

Hwah Jah.evaluation: Hwa-Jah is supposed to be a damage-oriented CVL, but with 6 Seaplanes her personal damage is awful. The barrage isn't good enough to carry. Collection-only. Note: She has CV RLD+1 fleet technology at Level 120.

Ting An.evaluation: Ting An is a support-oriented AE with bad personal damage. Her stats are not very good, since her AVI is too low to do any personal damage even with barrages. In addition, her HP is too low for her to main tank. Her Skill 1 buffs are very rng reliant on getting the right ones, and even then other buffers can do the job way better. Just use a ship that has high personal damage instead. Collection only.

Yat Sen.evaluation: Yat Sen (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. She always had enough bulk to main tank most mob content, but now that doesn't require Ning/Ping Hai. Her personal damage is vastly increased due to higher gun efficiencies and FP stat. In addition, she loses reliance on Ning/Ping Hai for her own bulk, although you still need her to buff Ning/Pings bulk in China Wall teams. Retrofit skill fires a decent barrage every 12s as well, which is decent free damage. Great improvement over base Yat Sen, and an above-average CL overall.

Implacable.evaluation: Implacable is a support-oriented CV with great damage and amazing skills. Her skills are confusing, but for the most part your fleet is guaranteed max stacks of "No Mercy" every airstrike, giving her great damage output. Her support freezes the enemy, which is amazing for other BBs and CVs alike to land their shots/bombs/torpedoes. The crossfleet is basically negligible for most intentd and purposes though, since the effect is only once per battle. Overall, she is an amazing ship; highly worth getting.

Royal Oak.evaluation: Royal Oak is a off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and interesting skills. Her barrage is based upon taking damage or after 20s has passed, both of which allow her to run a shelling gun instead of a barrage gun. Her damage redirection is niche and her self heal is useless for most purposes since backline ships rarely take meaningful damage. She technically prefers flagship but is fine as an off-flag. Overall, typical event SSR. Not horrible but not top tier.

Scylla.evaluation: Scylla is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her equipment loadout is nothing to write home about, but her barrages are all very good, making her damage really high. Her supportive capabilities are all worse than existing good ships. Her AA is above average. Overall, highly worth getting.

Argus.evaluation: Argus is a support-oriented CVL with average stats but amazing skills. She buffs carriers inside and outside of the fleet, and has a self airstrike cooldown reduction for damage desyncing. Her personal damage is very mediocre however, especially if the barrage does not proc. Solid ship all around.

Hero.evaluation: Hero attempts to be a damage-oriented DD but has terrible stats. The skill are nice, especially the barrages (either of them), but it's not enough to get her over the hump. Collection only.

Kursk.evaluation: Kursk is a damage-oriented CA with decent stats and very unique skills. Her damage is above average, but nothing exceptional. The AoA is decent, the bombs are also decent, and the special submarines fire a decent number of torpedoes, all giving her great damage alongside the MGM+1 main gun. Overall, she is a great CA.

Voroshilov.evaluation: Voroshilov is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her special secondary gun is really good, and mostly compensates for her lack of a 2nd MGM. Her barrages are also really good, and her bulk is excellent to boot. Her Frozen debuff is nice, but not needed for her to be amazing. Overall, she is a great ship.

Sevastopol.evaluation: Sevastopol is a barrage-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her barrage would be nice if the proc rate was higher, but 50% is too rng to be reliable. In addition, the heal is very minor compared to using a dedicated healer (like Unicorn). Overall, she is collection only.

Bismarck Zwei.evaluation: Bismarck Zwei is an amazing damage-oriented BB. Her Skill 1 gives her great self-buffs, along with a barrage that is able to take advantage of the zone it creates. Her Skill 2, especially the Release part, gives her a summon that does great, consistent, damage to enemies on the field. Her crossfleet skill is decent, but KMS CVs aren't good enough yet to make a KMS CV fleet worthwhile. Overall, she is an amazing BB; highly worth getting.

Regensburg.evaluation: Regensburg is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and interesting skills. Her skills incentivize her being in a KMS fleet, which is suboptimal. In addition, her skill locks on to enemies every 15s, which doesn't sync well with current options. Furthermore, her skills give her more bonuses if there is a locked on enemy alive at the time of activation, which is unreliable outside of bossing. Her barrages are pretty good, but only 1 MGM hurts her damage. Overall, she is a good CL.

Otto von Alvensleben.evaluation: Otto von Alvensleben is a mob-tank oriented DD with great damage and skills. Her Skill 1 gives her a great barrage every 15s, which is where the majority of her damage comes from. Her Skill 2 greately increases her bulk along with the 30% auxiliary stat boost from max limit-break. Despite the AoA reduction when using a CL gun, a DD gun will be better the majority of the time. Overall, she is a great DD.

U-556 META.evaluation: U-556 META is an amazing damage-dealer SS with great stats and skills. Her stats are pretty typical for an SSR SS. She gets torpedo crit rate and self torpedo buffs from her skills, further boosting her damage. In addition, her Skill 3 allows her to spam a torpedo barrage, albeit a weak one. You do NOT need Bismarck / Bismarck Zwei in the fleet for her to be viable. Overall, she is an amazing SS.

Jade.evaluation: Jade is a damage-oriented CVL that has meh damage and stats. Collection only.

Nelson.evaluation: Nelson (Retrofit) is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. She gains 15% more main gun efficiency, bringing her gun damage up to par with other SSR BBs. Her barrage proc rate also increases to 100%, although it still suffers the same issues as the original Big Seven (not arcing, not as single-target oriented). The single target barrage is decent, but nothing amazing. Overall, she is a great ship; one of the best easily acquirable BBs for new players.

Taihou-chan.evaluation: Taihou-chan is a damage oriented CV with average stats and great skills. Her stats are lower than other good CVs due to being elite rarity, but they are still good enough. Her skills give her a self AVI boost, as well as a timed barrage and Main Fleet support. Overall, she is a good CV.

Attilio Regolo.evaluation: Regolo is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. She has MGM+1 with AoA reduction, making her gun damage pretty good. In addition, her Skill 1 further adds on to her gun damage. Improving the proc chance of her Skill 2 by using RN ships is not relevant to her viability. Her AoA is also pretty good. Overall, she is a great DD.

Gorizia.evaluation: Goriza is a mob-tank/damage-oriented CA with great stats and and skills. Her main gun damage is pretty solid since she has MGM+1 with good FP. She is ideally sortied with an RN equipment to improve the proc chance of her Skill 1 barrage. Her Skill 2 also adds to her bulk a bit. Overall, she is a great CA.

Andrea Doria.evaluation: Doria is a flagship-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her barrage proc chance is only 50%, which is not good. Her supportive capabilities do not justify using her over other easily accessible BB options. Collection only.

Marseillaise.evaluation: Marseillaise is a mob-tank oriented CL with good stats and great skills. Her stats are pretty average for a gold CL, but her skills give her a lot of bulk to make up for it. Her damage is alright due to her barrages but only 1 MGM hurts. She also buffs French ships in the same fleet, however there aren't enough French ships currently to make this worthwhile. Overall she is a great CL, especially given that she is free for everyone!

Clemenceau.evaluation: Clemenceau is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. She trades 1 Main Gun Mount for a preloaded shot, which is nice for short fights, but hinders her damage output in longer fights. She is ideally sortied with French equipment in order to increase her barrage proc rate. Her self-buffs from having French ships in the fleet are not worth building around. Overall, she is a good BB.

Guichen.evaluation: Guichen is a mob-tank oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her damage is above average for a 1 MGM CL due to a good AoA which ignores shields and pierces, as well as her Skill 1. Her bulk is good enough to mob-tank, but not good enough against bosses. Her stop is not worth building a fleet around. Overall, she is a good CL.

Painlevé.evaluation: Painleve is a healer-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her Skill 1 is great support for your fleet regardless of which version is triggered. Her Skill 2 heals both herself and the vanguard a good amount, but 5s after an airstrike is fired might be too slow for some fleet compositions. Compared to other healers, having 8 planes is a huge benefit to her own personal damage. Overall she is a great CV.

Kersaint.evaluation: Kersaint is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Her skill is alright, but the heal is useless and the other two are useless when her base damage is already really low. Collection only.

Lyon.evaluation: Lyon is a damage-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her Main Gun damage is meh, and her barrage is only a 50% proc rate making her average damage even worse. Collection only.

Suffren.evaluation: Suffren is a damage-oriented CA with meh stats and skills. Her skills boost her damage by a decent bit, however her base damage is so low with only 1 MGM and low torpedo stats that it doesn't really make a difference. Her bulk is also not good enough to act as a tank for neither a boss nor mob fleet. Collection only.

West Virginia.evaluation: West Virgina (Retrofit) is a flagship damage-oriented BB with great stats and good skills. Her barrage is only a 70% proc rate, which is not ideal; however her shelling damage is above average to make up for it. She is ideally sortied with another BB/BC to enhance both her barrage and supportive capabilities as well. Overall, she is a good BB option.

Unzen.evaluation: Unzen is a damage-oriented CA with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high due to MGM+1 CA Guns, multiple barrages, and amazing torpedo self-buffs. Her torpedo damage is very high due to the CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG bonuses given to them. Her bulk is not good enough to Main Tank hard content, but it is more than enough to Off-Tank or put her in the middle Vanguard position. Due to her low base torpedo stat when compared to other torpedo ships, using a <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Type_93_Pure_Oxygen_Torpedo#Type_3-0" title="Type 93 Pure Oxygen Torpedo" >Type 93 Pure Oxygen Torpedo</a > gives her a very sizable damage increase compared to using it on other ships, and she has enough bulk even while equipping one to be fine, especially in the middle position. Her crossfleet skill is nice but unimportant. Overall, she is an amazing CA, suitable for any fleet.

Owari.evaluation: Owari is a off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is high due to her high self-buffs, good main gun efficiency, and great barrages. Her barrage has a lot of its damage aimed, but since some of it is centered, she is slightly better as a Flagship than as an Off-Flag. Her "Best Buds" support given to other ships is nice but unreliable in its targetting. She is ideally sortied such that her Skill 2 condition for barrage activation chance is satisfied. Overall, she is a great ship.

Hatsuzuki.evaluation: Hatsuzuki is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very balanced, with MGM+1 and solid torpedoes, as well as multiple barrages comprised of both shells and torpedoes. Her bulk is also pretty good for a DD, as she has some EVA and EVARate self buffs; however, her HP is still somewhat low. Her fleetwide damage-reduction is nice to have. She is ideally sortied with multiple IJN ships to make use of her Skill 1 Stack requirements. Overall, she is a great ship.

Natori.evaluation: Natori is a damage-oriented CL with meh stats and good skills. During the first 30s of battle, her personal damage is actually pretty good due to multiple great barrages, including a mini carpet-bomb that does great damage. Her bulk is also pretty good as well, with a good shield as well as damage reduction for all CLs in the fleet. Overall, she is a good ship, especially when mobbing.

Asanagi.evaluation: Asanagi is a support-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Her personal damage is bad, and her support is useless due to the 10s cooldown not justifying a 0.3s duration. Collection only.

Nachi.evaluation: Nachi (Retrofit) is a tank-oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her bulk is good enough to tank most content, and she has great fleet support, especially with other CA/CL/CB. Her personal damage is meh due to only 1 MGM. Her Skill 1 can be both situationally good or bad, depending on the damage of the stage she is on, so be wary. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

event.name: Tempesta and the Fountain of Youth

São Martinho.evaluation: São Martinho is an off-flag oriented IXM with great stats and great skills. Her damage is heavily hindered by her equipment options, but is still good despite that, due to MGM+5 and good barrages and self-buffs. In addition, she even has a almost-Preloaded Main Gun, helping clear mob fights faster. Her Tempesta Faction buff is nice, but not necessary to take advantage of for her viability. Her bulk against AVI damage is very bad, due to having 0 base AA stat. Overall, she is a great ship.

event.name: Tempesta and the Fountain of Youth

Golden Hind.evaluation: Golden Hind is a damage-oriented IXV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great, with MGM+2 DD guns as well as a great barrage. Her bulk is a bit on the frail side, but that is made up for by 3 auxiliary slots. In addition, she has no AA support, and has very decreased bulk against AVI damage due to her 0 base AA stat. Overall, she is a great ship.

event.name: Tempesta and the Fountain of Youth

Mary Celeste.evaluation: Mary Celeste is a damage-oriented IXS with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high, but it is heavily skewed towards Light and Medium Armor enemies. Her support is also decent, although the effectiveness of her "Ghost Ship" at redirecting enemy damage is to be determined. Overall, she is a great ship.

event.name: Tempesta and the Fountain of Youth

Adventure Galley.evaluation: Adventure Galley is a damage-oriented IXV with good stats and skills. Her damage is alright due to MGM+1, as well as a decent skill barrage. Her bulk is on the frailer side, but 3 auxiliary equipment slots somewhat offset that. In addition, she has no AA support, and has very decreased bulk against AVI damage due to her 0 base AA stat. Overall, she is a good ship, but at best she is a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

event.name: Tempesta and the Fountain of Youth

Whydah.evaluation: Whydah is a damage-oriented IXS with meh stats and skills. Her damage is heavily skewed towards Light Armor, due to her DD Guns. Her bulk is also suspect, especially in longer fights. Overall, she is good, but not comparable to SR Submarines.

event.name: Tempesta and the Fountain of Youth

Houston II.evaluation: Houston II is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to MGM+1 supplemented with good barrages. Her bulk is pretty good as well, with her Skill 2 giving her a lifeline once she is at low health. Overall, she is a great ship.

Guam.evaluation: Guam is a tank-oriented CB with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is high due to MGM+1 CB Guns, as well as multiple skill barrages. Her bulk is also very high as well due to her raw stats, as well as her Skill 2 barrier further augmenting it. Her AA capabilities are near the top of the game due to AA+1, as well as her raw AA stat plus her self-buffs. The 15% buff to AA that Guam grants to low AA ships is nice, but not necessary for her to be viable. Her crossfleet is also nice, but not necessary for her viability. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Laffey II.evaluation: Laffey II is a damage-oriented DD with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high; despite only having 1 MGM, she has 2 summons as well as multiple skill barrages to augment her damage further. Her Skill 2 grants her a special AA gun, as well as AA self-buffs, that raise her AA to very high levels when combined with her existing 180% AA mount. You want to equip her with a USS equipment due to her Skill 2. In addition, she can also keep USS CVs hidden more easily due to reducing their detection gauge. Her Skill 3 adds to her bulk significantly. Despite her Skill 1 self barrage starting at 70%, for all procs after the first one it is very easy for it to maintain 100% proc chance. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Constellation.evaluation: Constellation is an off-flag oriented BC with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very good due to an effective 100% proc chance barrage when equipped with a USS gear, as well as her self-buffs. Since most trash mobs are very slow, the buff to enemies with lower speed is nice, but trash mobs die quickly anyway so this buff's effectiveness is diminished. Overall, she is a great ship.

Flasher.evaluation: Flasher is a damage-oriented SS with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very good, especially since she can debuff multiple enemies at once to take more damage from her. Her buffs for other Gato-class SS are nice, but not required to build the entire fleet around since she can trigger the requirement herself. The extra hunting range is nice, but not necessary for her viability. Overall, she is a great ship.

San Jacinto.evaluation: San Jacinto is a damage-oriented CVL with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is hindered somewhat by 6 planes, but she gets increased slot efficiency and skill barrages to compensate. The ASW strike from her Skill 1 is alright, but very niche since current ASW content is very easy to deal with. Her Skill 2 is nice, but reliant on her taking damage, which as a backline ship is somewhat rare. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Louisville.evaluation: Louisville is a damage-oriented CA with good stats and meh skills. Her personal damage is alright due to MGM+1 CA guns, but only 60% chance for her skill barrage is not ideal. Her bulk is mediocre even when accounting for her Skill 1 shields. Overall, she is a meh ship; at best a sidegrade to more easily available options.

Huan Ch'ang.evaluation: Huan Ch'ang is a flagship-oriented BC with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to MGM+2 BB Guns and a good barrage. She is ideally sortied with another Dragon Empery ship to increase her barrage trigger chance to 100%. Her buff to either the Vanguard or Main Fleet is nice, but the Main Fleet buff is significantly more impactful than the Vanguard Fleet buff. Her Skill 2 allows her to ignore the Out-Of-Ammo debuff, making her more effective in a mob fleet compared to a boss fleet. Overall, she is a good ship.

Chi An.evaluation: Chi An is a damage-oriented CL with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Lung Wu.evaluation: Lung Wu is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. She has double the torpedo launches of a normal ship, but because of her stats being bad, this doesn't improve her viability. Collection only.

Hu Pen.evaluation: Hu Pen is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. She has double the torpedo launches of a normal ship, but because of her stats being bad, this doesn't improve her viability. Collection only.

Fei Yuen.evaluation: Fei Yuan is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. She has double the torpedo launches of a normal ship, but because of her stats being bad, this doesn't improve her viability. Collection only.

Chen Hai.evaluation: Chen Hai (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented CVL with meh stats and good skills. Her loadout is drastically improved, but only 5 planes is still bad, despite the high efficiencies. She has multiple good barrages, but they don't make up for the lack of planes. Overall, she is a meh ship, and is outclassed by other easily accessible options.

Tai Yuan.evaluation: Tai Yuan (Retrofit) is a damage-oriented DD with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is amazing due to great self-buffs, MGM+1 DD Guns, a Missile, and multiple good barrages. The shield from her Skill 2 barrage is nice, but not necessary for her viability. Never use her in Main Fleet Mode; Vanguard Fleet Mode is a lot better for her self-damage. The Missile Strike is nice, but is not necessary for her viability. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Sovetsky Soyuz.evaluation: Sovetsky Soyuz is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is amazing due to very high self-buffs, very high Main Gun efficiencies, and a barrage that always procs and always lands on its target. Her Skill 1 applies debuffs to enemies hit by her barrage, increasing the damage of the entire fleet. Her Skill 2 grants buffs depending on the Main Fleet composition; both are very good and don't affect her usage at all. Her Skill 3 is defensive oriented, but not relevant in PvE content. Her crossfleet barrage is nice, but since it only triggers once per battle the other fleet cannot take advantage of the support from the barrage relaibly. Overall, she is an amazing ship; highly worth getting.

Ognevoy.evaluation: Ognevoy is a damage-oriented DD with good stats and great skills. Her self-buffs are great due to all 3 of her skills granting her an FP buff of some sort. Combined with her barrages, and her damage is great. Her Skill 2 triggering multiple times due to sinking enemies is nice, but unreliable due to the 70% proc rate of the original barrage. Her bulk is on the frailer end, so she is ideally sortied in the middle position of the Vanguard Fleet. Her Skill 1 heal is basically equivalent to a Repair Toolkit for the majority of battles, and is unable to solo-sustain a fleet during difficult content. Overall, she is a great ship.

Pamiat' Merkuria META.evaluation: Pamiat' Merkuria META is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to MGM+1 DD Guns, and multiple barrages (including her AoA that can ignore shields!). Her Skill 3 slows enemies within a reasonably sized radius of her, which is nice but somewhat unreliable. Her bulk is also very good due to her Skill 2 allowing her to evade damage, but her relatively lower bulk stats compared to other tanks makes her overall bulk worse than it seems. Overall, she is a great ship.

Poltava.evaluation: Poltava is an off-flag support-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is very lackluster due to low Main Gun efficiencies and FP stat. Her barrage is decent, but is unreliable due to requiring her to take damage. Since each Main Gun shell is counted individually, her Skiil 1 support will almost always trigger. Despite this, it is very mediocre due to the slow being a small amount and the damage buffs being for niche ships. Collection only.

Svirepy.evaluation: Svirepy is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. She has few self-buffs, and only 1 MGM, making her damage mediocre. Her barrages are alright, but nothing special. Collection only.

Friedrich Carl.evaluation: Friedrich Carl is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is high, despite only having 1 MGM, due to possessing a special secondary gun, and having multiple aimed barrages from her Skill 2. She can equip the Triple 283mm CB Gun to bypass shields more effectively, along with her barrages already ignoring shields inherantly. She is ideally sortied in a full vanguard so she can give the off-tank Tuning. The heal from her Skill 1 is negligable, due to how little it will contribute over the course of the battle. Her bulk is also high due to her high HP, EVA self-buffs, and EVA Rate self-buffs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Nubian.evaluation: Nubian is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to MGM+1 DD Guns, and multiple barrages. She gains increased CRIT Rate / DMG as the battle goes on for longer, which is a solid buff. The slash attack is nice as it ignores shields, and clears bullets / torpedoes in its way. Her Skill 2 debuff is good, but the sonar is not that useful for the majority of content in the game. Furthermore, the debuff does not have a 100% proc rate. Overall, she is a great ship.

Devonshire.evaluation: Devonshire is a damage-oriented CA with meh stats and skills. Her damage is mediocre outside of her Skill 1 barrage, but that alone is not enough to carry her. Her heal is alright, but nothing special as it's only 8% of her HP once per battle. Her Skill 2 is great, but doesn't have a 100% proc rate, and her equipped weapons are not strong enough to take advantage significantly. Overall, she is a meh ship, and is a sidegrade to other easily accessible options.

Liverpool.evaluation: Liverpool is a damage-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Her damage is mediocre outside of her Skill 1 barrage. She is ideally equipped with a fast torpedo to trigger her Skill 1 barrage more often. Her Skill 2 can generate a barrier when she is at low health, but she is still on the average side in terms of bulk. Her FP buff to other Vanguard Fleet ships is nice, but not worth her slot in the fleet. Overall, she is a meh ship, and is a sidegrade to other easily accessible options.

Noshiro μ.evaluation: Noshiro μ is a support-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good, despite only 1 MGM, due to her skill barrages and torpedoes. Her bulk is also fairly high due to her Skill 1, although it is not high enough to main tank hard content. Her Skill 2 is very good, inflicting a torpedo damage taken debuff to all enemies guaranteed. Overall, she is a great ship, best used in torpedo-oriented vanguards.

Formidable μ.evaluation: Formidable μ is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and good skills. Her personal damage is pretty good with 8 planes, an AVI self-buff, and a good skill barrage from her Skill 3. Her Skill 1 grants her a preloaded airstrike, but only if there are other μ ships in the fleet, making it somewhat difficult to build around since most μ ships are not good. Her Skill 2 is niche since it's impossible to sync up the stop with other Main Fleets ships, and its not a 100% proc chance. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options if she doesn't have a preload.

Prinz Eugen μ.evaluation: Eugen μ is a mob tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to her skill barrages and AoA. Her Skill 1 drains her own HP to give buffs to your other characters, which can hinder her bulk if not paired with a healer. Despite this, her bulk is still fairly good. Her Skill 2 increases her personal damage by a sizable amount, and has a chance to fire a barrage; unfortunately the barrage doesn't have a 100% proc chance. Overall, she is a great ship.

Boise μ.evaluation: Boise μ is a damage-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to MGM+1 CL guns and a 100% chance barrage from her Skill 1. Her Skill 2 offers a small heal to all ships in your fleet, which can be nice but is unreliable if used as the only heal in the fleet. The reload buff it gives is a nice minor buff as well. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Le Téméraire μ.evaluation: Le Téméraire μ is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is alright due to good self-buffs and great barrages, but they don't have 100% proc rate. Her heal is good but unreliable if used as the only heal in the fleet. Collection only.

Kongou μ.evaluation: Kongou μ is a support-oriented BC with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is fairly mediocre due to her stats and barrage numbers being mediocre. The support she offers your Vanguard Fleet and μ ships is not worth slotting her into a fleet. Collection only.

Shinano-chan.evaluation: Shinano-chan is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to 9 planes and a timed Skill 1 barrage. The AA debuff from her Skill 1 is nice when buffing other CVs in your fleet. Her Skill 2 should NOT be built around when deciding who to use in the fleet. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Alsace.evaluation: Alsace is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high with MGM+2 BB Guns, and an aimed barrage as well. She has a preloaded Main Gun, which helps both when mobbing and bossing to deal with early wave enemies. Her increase to Main Gun capacity is nice for avoiding delays, but overall irrelevant in most content. Her Skill 1 inflicts a nice debuff to enemies, although due to its random targetting its more useful against single-target bosses. Her Skill 2 improves her Skill 1 to last for longer, but the extension isn't as useful since it already syncs with the Main Fleet; sortieing her with FFNF/MNF ships isn't necessary for this condition. Her Skill 3 barrage does no damage, and the heal can only trigger once per battle, making it only useful for the CRIT Rate buffs. Her crossfleet is nice, but not necessary for her viability. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Mogador.evaluation: Mogador is a damage-oriented DD with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is high with MGM+1 DD Guns, a good AoA, and multiple additional Main Gun shots from her skills. Her bulk can be suspect due to her Skill 1 lunging her forward, but any form of minor healing is enough to negate this. Her Skill 2 improves her bulk by a decent amount, and also allows her to fire 1 additional Main Gun shot every 3s. Her Skill 3 is also mainly for the additional Main Gun shot every 2s when hitting an enemy afflicted with a DoT. Overall, Mogador is an amazing ship.

Béarn META.evaluation: Béarn META is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her Skill 1 gives her a 70% on-strike barrage, with a guaranteed trigger every 2 launches, which is good but not ideal. Her Skill 2 tornado isn't really relevant due to the 3 activation limit per battle, as well as it dealing almost no damage. Her Skill 3 can improve her Skill 1 barrage based on whether a CL gun or Dive Bomber is equipped in slot 3. In addition, her Skill 3 grants her a fast-load, which can be improved even further when equipped with a Dive Bomber. Due to this, equipping a Dive Bomber in slot 3 is generally preferred, due to the improved fast-load, Béarn META having better AVI scaling compared to FP scaling, and the barrage not getting blocked by shields. Overall, she is a great ship.
Béarn META.preload: 50% 1st Airstrike Cooldown Reduction (20% initially, +30% if Dive Bomber in Slot 3).

Brennus.evaluation: Brennus is a mob-tank oriented CA with great stats and good skills. Her personal damage is great due to MGM+1 CA Guns, and a good AoA. Her skills orient around her summoning swords (shields), and depending on how many of them remain intact, triggering certain effects. Due to the nature of shields in Azur Lane, chances are the majority of them will get destroyed before the 20s check, causing her Skill 2 barrage to do barely any damage. Due to the timings of the swords and the skill check not lining up, she will only have the swords active for 15s out of a 20s skill rotation. Her bulk is also good, but nothing exceptional, especially without any shields. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Épée.evaluation: Épée is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Fleuret.evaluation: Fleuret is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Collection only.

Colorado.evaluation: Colorado (Retrofit) is a flagship damage-oriented BB with great stats and good skills. Her damage is great due to MGM+2 BB guns, and an amazing barrage from her Skill 1; only a 70% barrage trigger chance is not ideal, however. Her Skill 2 self-buffs her FP and ACC by quite a bit. Overall, she is a great ship, but can be a sidegrade to other easily accessible options.

Little Friedrich.evaluation: Little Friedrich is a flagship damage-oriented BB with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to MGM+2 BB Guns, and a solid proximity barrage. Her skill 2 barrage is weak, and it is not necessary to sortie her with other Little ships to improve its effectiveness. Overall, she is a good ship.

Alvitr.evaluation: Alvitr is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to MGM+2 BB guns and 2 good barrages (one timed, one on Main Gun salvos). However, both barrages aren't 100% activation chance, and when the Skill 1 "spear" is moving backwards any shield will immediately destroy it. The special burn from her Skill 1 barrage is a nice bit of free damage as well. Her Skill 2 gives her CRIT self-buffs if her Skill 2 barrage hits enemies, which is doable to achieve if it procs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Z47.evaluation: Z47 is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great despite 1 MGM due to a really good AoA barrage, with her Skill 1 Torpedoes adding on to it. It's recommended to equip a fast-firing Main Gun on her to maximize her barrage damage, such as the Twin 100 Kai or Twin 114; the blue fast guns are also not bad as transitional options. Her Skill 1 can increase her Torpedo Efficiency by 10% when equipped with any KMS weapon, which is easily doable with her Torpedoes. Her Skill 2 increases her damage against Light Armor enemies by a large amount if they are nearby, which is very good when it can activate. Overall, she is a great ship.

Z43.evaluation: Z43 is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

U-31.evaluation: U-31 is a damage-oriented SS with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Strasbourg.evaluation: Strasbourg is an off-flag damage-oriented BC with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good since she has decent self-buffs MGM+1 BB Guns, a preloaded Main Gun, and a cooldown reduction 2nd shot too. However, her barrage requirements are annoying to satisfy since you need 2 other MNF ships in the fleet to guarantee it. Her support to other MNF ships is nice, but not necessary for her to be viable. Her stats are on the lower side for a gold BB as well. Overall, she is a great ship.

L'Audacieux.evaluation: L'Audacieux is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great, despite only 1 MGM, due to multiple good barrages and AoA reduction. Her skill 1 applies a debuff to enemies every 10s, indirectly increasing her own personal damage. Her skill 1 also gives her a self-buff that stacks as the battle goes on, which is really good. Her skill 2 is nice, but unreliable to proc. Overall, she is a great ship.

Dupleix.evaluation: Dupleix is a damage-oriented CA with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Indiana.evaluation: Indiana is a off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to MGM+2 BB Guns, and multiple solid barrages. Her Skill 1 barrage isn't locked to her position, but does different damage amounts based on the trigger condition. The trigger condition for the second barrage is also annoying to hit, and both barrages do not ignore shields. Her Skill 2 barrage is decent, and can be triggered 3 times per proc due to the shield regenerating. Overall, she is a great ship, but can be a sidegrade to other easily accessible options.

Pittsburgh.evaluation: Pittsburgh is a damage-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to MGM+1 CA Guns and her Skill 1 barrage. Her bulk is also good enough to off-tank. Her Skill 1 also inflicts a special burn on enemies, which can then trigger Armor Break when your flagship BB/BC/BBV fires a Main Gun shot, which is nice. Her Skill 2 AA gun is nice, but her AA is still not at the level of other AA carriers. Overall, she is a great ship.

Fargo.evaluation: Fargo is a support-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to MGM+1 CL Guns, and her Skill 2 barrage. Unfortunately, the Skill 2 barrage being a 70% trigger rate is not ideal. Her Skill 1 drops cargo on the field, which gives nice supplemental healing to your fleet. Her Skill 2 also provides a small buff to your Flagship's damage, which is better than nothing. Overall, she is a great ship.

Bell.evaluation: Bell is a support-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Her TRP buff to other ships is RNG, so she's not even usable in that role compared to other TRP buffers like Kasumi META. Collection only.

Herring.evaluation: Herring is a damage-oriented SS with bad stats and skills. Her heal to the surface fleet is RNG, and so is her retreat speed. Collection only.

Eldridge.evaluation: Eldridge (Retrofit) is a support-oriented DD with good stats and amazing skills. Despite having 2 AA Guns post-retrofit, her AA is not enough to solo-carry a fleet; however, it is still above average. Upon retrofit, she gains a special ASW weapon with stats similar to a +10 Hedgehog, which drastically increases her ASW capabilities. Her Skill 1 provides complete immunity for all Vanguard damage taken, although the trigger condition can be hard to satisfy if she is in the center of the Vanguard Fleet. Her retrofit enhances this skill to prevent DoT or other self-damage from happening. The Skill 1 Barrage is also good. Her Skill 2 gives her a barrage whenever the Flagship launches their main weapons, which is aimed and does good damage. Her AoA is improved upon retrofit to also do more damage, which is nice; no AoA reduction hurts though. Overall, she is a great ship.

Zuihou.evaluation: Zuihou is a healer-oriented CVL with average stats and good skills. Compared to Unicorn (Retrofit), Zuihou heals less overall, but part of her healing is based on her own HP, and all of her healing targets lower HP ships within the fleet (except 1 random tick from her Skill 1). Her Skill 1 barrage is good, but her personal damage is still mediocre due to a 6-plane loadout. Her Skill 2 buffs your Submarine Fleet and Main Fleet by a decent amount as well. Overall she is a great ship, but not worth using over Unicorn (Retrofit).

Neptune.evaluation: Neptune is a mob-tank oriented CL with good stats and skills. She only has 1 MGM, but her skill that boosts her AP damage makes up for it. Her AoA barrage is very good; however no pierce despite being AP hurts a bit. Her bulk is also fine, and supplemented by her self-heal. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to other easily accessible options.

Monarch.evaluation: Monarch is a flagship damage-oriented BB with great stats and good skills. Her main gun damage is great, and supplemented by a great barrage that can slow enemies hit. The barrage being 70% is not ideal, however. Her Skill 2 is effectively negligable for almost all battles, and the FS5 does not improve it much at all. Overall, she is a great ship, but can be a sidegrade to most modern event BBs.

Ibuki.evaluation: Ibuki is a damage-oriented CA with good stats and great skills. She only has 1 MGM, but her double preloaded torpedoes allow her to frontload a large portion of damage. Her self-buffs to her torpedo damage boost it from middling to amazing, especially when combined with her high torpedo mount efficiency. Her Skill 2 barrage is amazing, especially after her Augment Module improved its damage and increased its trigger rate to 100%. The invulrunability gained from her Skill 2 is nice, but not too relevant for her. Overall, she is a great ship.

Izumo.evaluation: Izumo is a flagship damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her shelling damage is good, and combined with her barrage gives her great damage output. Her barrage has a 100% activation chance, which is very good considering how wide the barrge is. Her barrage can get partially blocked by enemy shields, but that shouldn't be an issue on most stages. Her AP damage taken reduction skill is nice to have, but not necessary for her viability. Overall, she is a great ship.

Roon.evaluation: Roon is a tank-oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her bulk is good, which combined with her shields give her a solid amount of survivability. Her personal damage is also good, with MGM+1 CA guns combined with her self-buffs that get larger as the battle progresses. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to other easily accessible options.

Saint Louis.evaluation: Saint Louis is a mob-tank / damage-oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her bulk is good while her Skill 2 is up, but middling after. Her personal damage is good, with MGM+1 CA guns combined with her self-buffs when equipping an HE gun. You want to equip an HE gun to get the most value from her Skill 1. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to other easily accessible options.

Azuma.evaluation: Azuma is a tank-oriented CB with amazing stats and skills. Her bulk is very high, and she can equip the <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/VH_Armor_Plating" title="VH Armor Plating" >VH Armor Plating</a > to situationally improve it. Her personal damage is also very good, with MGM+1 CB Guns and good barrages. She is ideally equipped with a CB gun to take full advantage of her self-buffs. Overall, she is an amazing ship, but not high priority if you have other UR CBs already.

Friedrich der Große.evaluation: Friedrich der Große is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high due to high Main Gun efficiencies, great self buffs, and multiple barrages. Her proximity barrage, combined with its frequency, is one of the best ways to defend the backline from threats. Overall, she is an amazing BB; highly worth getting.

Seattle.evaluation: Seattle is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to MGM+1 CL Guns, self-buffs, and a good AoA barrage. Her bulk (when placed in the off-tank position), is also high, despite her being Light Armor. Her AA is not at the same level as AA carries, but is still above average. Overall, she is a great ship.

Georgia.evaluation: Georgia is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with good stats and good skills. Her shelling damage is nothing special since she only has MGM+1 Main Guns, instead of the usual MGM+2. Her barrage is very strong when it lands, but it is very narrow and prone to missing, not to mention it not having a 100% proc chance. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to most modern event BBs.

Kitakaze.evaluation: Kitakaze is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very good due to MGM+1 DD Guns, good torpedoes, and good barrages. Her skill changes her Main Guns to do drastically more against Heavy Armored enemies in exchange for being slightly worse against Light Armored enemies, which is a worthwhile tradeoff. She is ideally equipped with a Sakura Empire (IJN) Main Gun for her Skill 1 buff. You do NOT want her to be in the frontmost (tank) position for her skill condition; FS5 removes it anyways. Overall, she is a great ship.

Gascogne.evaluation: Gascogne is a flagship damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is good, despite MGM+1 Main Guns, since her barrage has a 100% proc rate and her Main Guns independently aim. Her Skill 1 healing is nice, and can help her stay alive slightly more easily against stages with significant backline pressure. Overall, she is a great ship, but can be a sidegrade to some modern Event BBs.

Drake.evaluation: Drake is a damage-oriented CA with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high due to MGM+1 CA Guns, plus her improved Ammo Modifiers from her Skill 1. Her Skill 1 changing her secondary gun modifiers is not that useful, however. She is ideally sortied with a Normal or HE ammo Main Gun to take advantage of the improved armor modifiers. Her Skill 2 barrage is very nice, but the heal is minor in practice. Her bulk is good, but isn't enough to Main Tank in very hard bossing content. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Cheshire.evaluation: Cheshire is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her bulk is high, and is more than sufficient to off-tank all content, and main-tank most content. Her AA is amazing, and is enough to AA-carry all content by herself. Her personal damage is mediocre, despite her skill barrages. Her fast-loaded torpedoes are nice, but since her torpedo damage is mediocre it is nothing special. You will likely max stack her Skill 2 effect in all battles. Overall, she is a great ship.

Mainz.evaluation: Mainz is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is high due to MGM+1 CL Guns, multiple good skill barrages, and her self-buffs. Her bulk is high enough to tank most content in the game, but isn't enough to main-tank in very hard bossing content. Her Fate Simulation removes her positional requirements, which is a very nice bonus to her personal damage when tanking. Overall, she is a great ship.

Odin.evaluation: Odin is an off-flag damage-oriented BC with great stats and skills. Her Skill 1 moves her to a unique position right in front of the Flagship, which can help tank damage otherwise intended for your flagship. Her personal damage is very good due to MGM+2 Main Guns, a timed barrage, and her special-secondary gun. Her Skill 1's submarine scan is very niche, and not relevant. Overall, she is a great ship.

Champagne.evaluation: Champagne is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good, despite only 1 MGM, due to her preloaded BB shot as well as drastically reduced Main Gun cooldown. Her barrages are nice, but nothing special. She can be a bit frailer than other BBs due to being Medium armor as well as having damage-redirection from the flagship. Her Main Gun ammo choice should be based on the enemy armor types, not her Skill 2. Overall, she is a good ship, but can be a sidegrade to more easily available options.

Ägir.evaluation: Agir is a tank-oriented CB with amazing stats and skills. Her bulk is one of the highest in the game, allowing her to tank every single difficult fight in the game. Her slow support from her torpedo launches and Armor Break from her Main Guns is nice overall support for a fleet. Her personal damage is still very solid with MGM+1 CB guns and a good Skill 3 barrage. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Hakuryuu.evaluation: Hakuryuu is a damage-oriented CV with amazing stats and skills. Her damage is among the highest in the game, especially when paired with other CV supporters (ex. Shinano, Kazagumo, etc.). Her support is nice to have, but underwhelming. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Anchorage.evaluation: Anchorage is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and amazing skills. Her bulk is very high due to her skills giving her barriers and invincibility throughout the fight, as well as a smokescreen. Her damage is still good as well due to MGM+1 CA guns and multiple barrages. You want to level her "Riddle Me This" skill due to the increase in damage you gain from it. Overall, she is the gold standard for tank CAs: an amazing ship.

August von Parseval.evaluation: August von Parseval is a support-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very good, especially in single-target scenarios against cruiser enemies. Her support is also very good, with a timestop improving your other ships's geometric accuracy against single-target enemies / bosses, as well as her aviation damage debuff. Overall, she is an amazing ship when her support is fully taken advantage of.

Marco Polo.evaluation: Marco Polo is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her barrage is very good, and has a very high proc rate. Her main guns are also very strong for a barrage-oriented BB, which allow her to be less reliant on RNG for her damage output. Her crossfleet skill is nice but nothing special. Overall, she is a great BB.

Plymouth.evaluation: Plymouth is a damage-oriented CL with high stats, great bulk, great skills, and an amazing loadout. She has MGM+2 CL guns with two strong barrages, making her a top overall damage vanguard in the entire game. Her skills give your flagship a huge damage boost as well. As one of the highest damage vanguard ships in the game, she is very worth getting.

Brest.evaluation: Brest is an extremely tanky CB with great stats and skills. Her damage output is around the other CBs due to MGM+1 CB Guns, but is still high in the grand scheme of tanks. She has a heal that can support the fleet, but it shouldn't be the only heal used. Her backwards secondary gun is effectively useless for all intents and purposes. Overall, she is an amazing ship, but not high priority if you have other UR CBs already.

Chkalov.evaluation: Chkalov is a damage-oriented CV with high stats, solid skills, and a solid loadout. Her airstrike barrage is very strong (especially when enhanced), and her debuff barrage, despite the bullets being weak, has a good enough pattern to proc it reliably. Her slow is nice, but the short duration makes it hard to sync with other ships in the same fleet. Lack of a Fighter hurts her in AA areas unless you have an intercept-capable Torpedo Bomber. Overall, she is an amazing CV.

Prinz Rupprecht.evaluation: Prinz Rupprecht is a flagship-oriented BC with solid stats and skills. Her barrage is solid, and has a high proc chance. She has a long range ghost gun for more free damage, as well as a great torpedo barrage off of it. She ideally prefers to be flagship due to her barrage pattern. Her heal is irrelevant when paired with a good healer like Unicorn. Overall, she is a great BB/BC option.

Harbin.evaluation: Harbin is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and amazing skills. She has great balanced damage from her MGM+1 DD guns, double Torpedo Launches, and double solid barrages. Her bulk is a bit on the frailer side, but her smokescreens help mitogate it and offer decent fleet support as well. Overall, she is an amazing CL.

Kearsarge.evaluation: Kearsarge is a off-flag damage-oriented BB with amazing stats and skills. She has amazing damage output with her BB guns, planes, and stat buffs. Her slow reload can be an issue in certain fleet compositions, but it can be built around without major issues. Her special secondary guns are awful for interception, but are better than not having them at all. Her Skill 2 buffs all CV and CVL damage in the fleet outright when paired with a USS Main Fleet ship, which is a very good buff. Overall, she is an amazing ship.
Kearsarge.preload: 30% 1st Airstrike Cooldown Reduction (USS / SN Fighter in Slot 2).

Hindenburg.evaluation: Hindenburg is a damage-oriented CA with amazing stats and skills. She has enough bulk to mob-tank in a pinch, but it is not recommended for her to tank over other good options. Her damage output is among the best in the game for vanguard ships due to multiple main gun mounts, as well as her shield-ignoring ability from her skills. Her Skill 2's special attack is very consistent especially against boss enemies. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Felix Schultz.evaluation: Felix Schultz is a mob-tank oriented DD with a great combination of damage and bulk. Her bulk is great due to her high HP, 30% Auxiliary stat boosts, and her skills. Her damage is not to be scoffed at as well due to multiple barrages. Her Skill 1 grants her great Crit buffs, as well as frontloading her barrage. Her Skill 2 drastically adds to her bulk as it gives her +EVA Rate very consistently. She can be equipped with either the Quadruple 152mm or the Twin 150mm TbtsK C42T0 due to her self-buffs from equipping a CL gun. Overall, she is a great ship.

Shimanto.evaluation: Shimanto is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her damage is great with MGM+1, double torpedo reloads, and multiple barrages. Her AA is also really good; using her gun to proc her skill can be useful situationally, but is not recommended for general use. Her Skill 1 can be situationally useful, especially when protecting backline ships. Her Skill 2 ghost AA gun is good, and the stacking from the third part of it should happen very fast. Her Fate Simulation unconditionally grants her the Skill 2 self-buffs, and adds minor shields. Overall, she is a great ship.

Flandre.evaluation: Flandre is an amazing off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats, skills, and a preloaded main gun to boot. Her Skill 1 gives her a timed, 100% chance, priority target barrage, which does a lot of damage, and is improved by her Fate Simulation. The marking effect from her Skill 1 is nice, but not necessary to play around for her to be good. Her Skill 2 is defensive-focused only, which is not useful for the majority of content. Overall, she is a amazing ship, but can be worse than UR BBs for some content.

Admiral Nakhimov.evaluation: Admiral Nakhimov is a damage-oriented CV with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high with 9 planes, self-buffs to AVI and CRIT Rate, and a great on-strike barrage. Her Skill 1 inflicts a 60% slow on all enemies on field, but it is delayed to 1.5s after her airstrike is launched, meaning that she herself won't be able to benefit from it as much. This can be buffed to stop all enemies on field when paired with another SN ship that can slow, but all SN ships that can slow currently don't have enough personal damage to make them worth using over other options. In addition, she gains a CRIT DMG buff when hitting enemies that are slowed by other SN ships, but timing it can be a hassle. Her Skill 3 gives her good defensive capabilities against being revealed, indirectly increasing her damage. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Napoli.evaluation: Napoli is a tank-oriented CA with amazing stats and skills. Her personal damage is good due to 1 MGM CA Guns, MGM+1 CL Guns, and her special secondary gun. However, all her barrages have very mediocre damage and have slow activation conditions, dragging her damage potential down. Her Skill 1 allows her to ignore shields when an enemy is close by, which is very handy. Her Skill 2 drastically increases her bulk, as while the smokescreen that helps all Vanguard Fleet is nice, the smokescreen that is only for herself lasts longer and buffs her CL Gun damage drastically. It also follows her around, meaning she is in the smokescreen longer. These smokescreens, along with her base stats, allow her to be the tankiest ship in the game, able to tank every single fight. Overall, she is an amazing ship.

Halford.evaluation: Halford is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great, despite only 1 MGM, due to her ability to equip the F8F Bearcat (Floatplane), and take advantage of its skill. Her Skill 1 additionally grants her a 15s Seaplane barrage, which both has good damage and has a guaranteed debuff when it lands. Due to how great the F8F Bearcat (Floatplane) is, you want to always be equipping one in Slot 3 over AA guns. Her Skill 2 has self-buffs and an additional barrage when not equipping a Seaplane, but the benefits of the Seaplane (damage, passive interception, screen-clear), outweigh the gains from Skill 2. The benefits from Skill 2 when equipping a Seaplane are nice, but nothing exceptional. Overall, she is a great ship.

Daisen.evaluation: Daisen is an off-flag damage-oriented / support-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to MGM+2 BB Guns, and a guaranteed, priority-target barrage. Her Skill 1 improves this barrage with different effects, both of which are great. The toggle when equipped with an IJN AA Gun is not relevant; there is no need to build around it. Her Skill 2 launches a recon plane which increases Daisen's personal damage to that enemy by a large amount, but it doesn't have priority targetting. When this palne is shot down, she heals the entire Vanguard Fleet by 8% HP, which is enough to solo-sustain a mob-fleet. Overall, she is a great ship.

Bayard.evaluation: Bayard is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is high due to MGM+1 CL Guns, her Skill 1 barrage, and her AoA. Her Skill 1 drastically increases her survivability for half her uptime, in addition to firing a great barrage. Her Skill 2 gives her great self-buffs, although the lower HP -> +DMG Dealt buff is unreliable due to how relatively tanky she is. The decrease all enemy ACC debuff is useless due to it's effect and activation condition being awful. Overall, she is a great ship.

Hiryuu META.evaluation: Hiryuu META is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her per-strike damage is great due to multiple skill barrages, and her 8 plane loadout. Since the barrages are centered around her, she ideally prefers flagship position for maximum effectiveness, but is still fine off-flag, especially when you are using Flagship BBs. She ideally is sortied with IJN Equipment to trigger her self-buffs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Ark Royal META.evaluation: Ark Royal META is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and good skills. Her per strike damage is very high, especially against single-target enemies where all her Torpedo Bombers can land. Her slow support is nice, but the slow percentage is too small to enable consistent CV support. Her on-strike barrages are a bit weak as well. Overall, she is a good ship, but outclassed by <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Ark_Royal" title="Ark Royal" >Ark Royal (Retrofit)</a >.

Helena META.evaluation: Helena META is a damage dealer / support-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her Skill 2 zone is useless due to how unreliable it is to set up, especially on auto-battle. Her Skill 1 allows her to support her entire fleet, however you want to not be equipping an Eagle Union gear to enable 20s timing, as 15s timing is very niche to sync around. Her personal damage and bulk are both pretty good, especially due to her self-buffs and her skill barrages. Overall, she is a great ship.

Souryuu META.evaluation: Souryuu META is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. Her per-strike damage is great due to multiple skill barrages, and her 8 plane loadout. Since the barrages are centered around her, she ideally prefers flagship position for maximum effectiveness, but is still fine off-flag, especially when you are using Flagship BBs. She ideally is sortied with IJN Equipment to trigger her self-buffs. Overall, she is a great ship.

Gneisenau META.evaluation: Gneisenau META is an off-flag damage-oriented BC with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is very high due to multiple aimed barrages and good main guns. The debuff from her Skill 2 Torpedo Barrage is situational due to its awkward timing. She is ideally sortied with a KMS Equipment to maximize her Skill 3 self-buffs. Only 1 Auxiliary Gun means her interception is weaker than most other BBs, but she has a unique long-range ghost gun to compensate for this. Overall, she is a great ship.

Scharnhorst META.evaluation: Scharnhorst META is an off-flag damage-oriented BC with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is average due to her barrages weak base damage, and her average Main Guns. Her equipped torpedo damage is bad, even with the increased range and spread buffs, so she is ideally equipped with a fast torpedo to trigger her barrage more often. No Auxiliary gun means her interception is weaker than other BBs, but she has a unique long-range ghost gun to compensate for this. Overall, she is a good ship.

Repulse META.evaluation: Repulse META is an off-flag damage-oriented BC with good stats and great skills. Stats are alright, but her barrages are very good and more than make up for them. She is still good as an off-flag, but for maximum performance you want her in the Flagship slot. Overall, she is a great BC, very worthy of being an SR.

Renown META.evaluation: Renown META is a great mobbing-oriented off-flag BC with solid stats. Her barrages have a nice pattern but are pretty underwhelming in base power. Due to her skill, she effectively gets a free salvo compared to the average BB/BC, which is always nice. Shields for the vanguard are always welcome as well. Overall, she seems solid; nothing exceptional but not bad either.

Arizona META.evaluation: Arizona META is a damage-oriented BB with great stats, proximity barrages and great support. The zone from Skill 1 is decently big as well. Good BB overall.

Queen Elizabeth META.evaluation: Queen Elizabeth META is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with good stats and skills. Her shelling damage is average, but her barrages more than make up for it. The marking for META/HMS ships is pointless, and so is the random META ship in the fleet dealing more damage. You can sortie her with other META ships to get all her buffs, but that is not necessary for her to be viable. Overall, she is a great BB.

Algérie META.evaluation: Algérie META is a damage-oriented CA with great stats and interesting skills. Since she only has 1 MGM, her damage is average at best. Her skills are also decent, with good barrages and burns, but they are unreliable and don't improve her damage that much. Overall, she is an average CA.

Jintsuu META.evaluation: Jintsuu META is a support-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her torpedo support is slightly worse than original Jintsuu, but her bulk and personal damage are a lot higher to compensate for it. Both her barrages (S1, AoA) have priority targetting, which also help her personal damage out. Overall, she is a great CL.

Kirov META.evaluation: Kirov META is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is high due to her summon, in addition to a aimed barrage every 15s. Her AoA is also good as well. Her bulk is fine; nothing special. The increased range to her Main Gun makes her damage more consistent. Overall, she is a great ship.

Rodney META.evaluation: Rodney META is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her Skill 1 creates 2 summons, who individually deal decent amounts of damage. She has great damage with MGM+2 BB Guns, and 2 barrages: one with a high (but not 100%) proc rate that has priority aiming, and one every 12s from her summons. The heal when her summons die is irrelevant, you want them alive as long as possible. Overall, she is a great ship.

Wichita META.evaluation: Wichita META is a damage-oriented CA with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is high with MGM+1 Main Guns and good barrages. Her bulk is very frail, being light armor and having HP drain in her skills. She does have a zombie-skill, but that tanks her damage a lot after it activates, so if she remains at low HP she is dead weight. Overall, she is a good ship, but due to her frailty she can be a sidegrade to other easily accessible options.

Nagato META.evaluation: Nagato META is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is great due to MGM+2 BB Guns, and an amazing barrage. Her Skill 1 is good, but the IJN benefits gained are outweighted from the benefits from not using an IJN ship in her Skill 3. Her Skill 2 gives a nice buff to all Vanguard Ships, and can even trigger on equipment heals like Repair Toolkit. Her Skill 3 gives her a guaranteed on-fire barrage. Ideally, she is sortied with no IJN ships to maximize the power of this barrage, as it removes the RNG requirement. Overall, she is a great ship.

Fusou META.evaluation: Fusou META is a flagship-oriented BB with meh stats and skills. Her gun damage is alright, but her barrage damage is pretty bad, and has a very wide pattern such that it is bad against single-target enemies. She has a crossfleet skill, but that doesn't improve her viability nor make her worth using. Overall, she is a meh ship, and is outclassed by other easily accessible options.

Hiyou META.evaluation: Hiyou META is a damage-oriented CVL with bad stats and skills. She has an on-strike barrage, but her personal damage is still really bad despite it. Collection only.

Junyou META.evaluation: Junyou META is a damage-oriented CVL with bad stats and skills. She has an on-strike barrage, but her personal damage is still really bad despite it. Collection only.

Yamashiro META.evaluation: Yamishiro META is a damage-oriented BB with good stats and meh skills. She only has 2 MGM, but compensates for this with reduced cooldown on her first 2 Main Gun shots. She also has a decent on-fire barrage. Overall, she is a meh ship, and is outclassed by other easily accessible options.

Memphis META.evaluation: Memphis META is a damage-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Stats are okay, but damage is lackluster, and skills are bad. The slow is gimmicky, as well as the damage boost to certain factions. The +EVA to some meta ships is a joke since it doesn't improve their survivability significantly. Collection tier only.

Trento META.evaluation: Trento META is a damage-oriented CA with meh stats, bad bulk, only 1 MGM, and a barrage that isn't good enough to take her over the hump. Overall, she is bad; collection only.

Hunter META.evaluation: Hunter META is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Fortune META.evaluation: Fortune META is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats, middling skills, middling barrages, only 1 MGM. Collection only.

Sheffield META.evaluation: Sheffield META is a damage-oriented CL with a bit of support on the side. Since she only has 1 MGM, her barrages aren't good enough to make up for the lack of damage compared to other CLs. Collection only.

La Galissonnière META.evaluation: La Galissonnière META is a damage-oriented CL with decent stats and skills. Her damage seems decent despite only 1 MGM due to her barrage, but it is nothing exceptional. Her bulk is also very average for a CL. Overall, she's meh.

Vestal META.evaluation: The opportunity cost of using Vestal META over any other easily-acquirable backline ship is not worth it, due to her support not being that worthwhile and her damage being lackluster. Collection only.

Hatakaze META.evaluation: Hatakaze META is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Princeton META.evaluation: Princeton META is a damage-oriented CVL with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is meh due to only having 6 planes, but her (unfortunately RNG) barrages add to it. She also offers no additional fleetwide support. Overall, she is a good ship, but at best she is a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Erebus META.evaluation: Erebus META is a flagship-oriented BB with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is very RNG reliant on her barrage, but it is a very very good barrage, especially for a lower rarity BB. Her self-buffs are decent, but only MGM+1 makes her shelling damage weak. Her heal is nice, but not relevant to her viability. Her bulk is also more suspect, due to her being Light Armor and her low HP relative to other BBs. Overall, she is a good ship, but at best she is a sidegrade to more easily accessible options.

Kimberly META.evaluation: Kimberly META is a damage-oriented DD with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is alright despite 1 MGM, due to multiple good barrages. Overall, she is a meh ship, and is outclassed by other easily accessible options.

Vampire META.evaluation: Vampire META is a damage-oriented DD with bad stats and skills. Overall, she is a bad ship, and is outclassed by other easily accessible options.

Foch META.evaluation: Foch META is a damage-oriented CA with meh stats and skills. Her personal damage is mediocre at best, due to a solid barrage but only 1 MGM. Her out-of-ammo penalty reduction is nice, but not enough to save her. Her bulk is also nothing special. Collection only.

Kasumi META.evaluation: Kasumi META is a support-oriented DD with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is good, despite only 1 MGM, due to her Torpedo stat being very high. Her Skill 1 both supports all Torpedo DDs, and gives her a decent barrage. Her Skill 2 is basically useless since your Vanguard Fleet rarely dies every battle. Overall, she is a good ship, best used in manual-battle Torpedo-oriented fleets.

Marie Rose.evaluation: Marie Rose is a damage-oriented DD with great stats and skills. Her Skill 1 has a barrage that will proc every 10s in most content, and her Skill 2 buffs her torpedo damage even more. Her augment skill buffs her own damage more as well. Her additional support is nice, but is not necessary. Overall, she is a great ship.

Honoka.evaluation: Honoka is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and interesting skills. Her Skill 1 has good self-buffs; although some of the possible barrages are better than others. Her Skill 2 has a nice damage 100% proc rate barrage which does good damage. The healing is unreliable, but it is a nice cushion alongside an actual healer-oriented ship. Overall, she is a great ship.

Misaki.evaluation: Misaki is a damage-oriented CL with good stats and skills. Her damage is pretty good with MGM+1 coupled with the self-buffs and augments, and her bulk is fine as well. Overall, she is a great ship.

Luna.evaluation: Luna is a damage-oriented CVL with good stats and interesting skills. Due to her nature of being fast loaded, she is much better in mob fleets when compared to boss fleets. Only 6 total planes hurts her overall damage output, so after her first two launches her worth is reduced. Do NOT run an ASW plane in her slot 3, it is useless. Needs more testing.

Tamaki.evaluation: Tamaki is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with great stats and skills. Her Skill 1 has a nice debuff to all enemies on the field. In addition, since her secondary gun range is increased, she has more capable interception. Her barrage is aimed, and has a 100% chance to proc with her augment. Overall, she is a great ship.

Nagisa.evaluation: Nagisa is worse than easily acquirable good ships at her role. Collection only.

Monica.evaluation: Monica is worse than easily acquirable good ships at her role. Collection only.

Nyotengu.evaluation: Nyotengu is worse than easily acquirable good ships at her role. Collection only.

Azusa Miura.evaluation: Azusa Miura is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her bulk is a bit on the lower side for a tank. However, she has MGM+1 CA Guns, great self-buffs, and a skill barrage to make her damage above average for a tank. She is ideally sortied with multiple other Vanguard ships to avoid the negative effect of her Skill 3. Overall, she is a great ship.

Chihaya Kisaragi.evaluation: Chihaya Kisaragi is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. She has a first-strike cooldown reduction, allowing her to desync her damage from the rest of your Main Fleet easily. She has 8 planes, and that combined with her on-strike barrage makes her damage really good. Overall, she is a great ship.

Haruka Amami.evaluation: Haruka Amami is a support-oriented CL with average stats and skills. Her personal damage is a bit lackluster due to only 1 MGM and the skill barrage not being enough to make up for it. Her support is also not enough to justify using her over other damage options that can kill the enemy faster. Overall, she is a good ship, but she is a sidegrade / downgrade to easily accessible options.

Iori Minase.evaluation: Iori Minase is an off-flag damage-oriented BB with good stats and meh skills. Her stats are alright, but a lack of self-buffs hinders her damage output. Her barrage is also good, and has priority targetting. Overall, she is a good ship, but she is a sidegarde / downgrade to easily accessible options.

Ami Futami.evaluation: Ami Futami is a damage-oriented SS with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Mami Futami.evaluation: Mami Futami is a damage-oriented SS with meh stats and skills. Collection only.

Ritsuko Akizuki.evaluation: Ritsuko is a support-oriented AE with good stats and skills. Her personal damage is decent due to her high FP stat, and she can equip <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/List_of_Cargo" title="Cargo" >Cargo</a > gear to offer fleet support. Overall, she is a good ship.

Akane Shinjo.evaluation: Akane Shinjo is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. She has multiple 100% trigger chance barrages, as well as MGM+2 and good Main Gun damgae to go alongside them. Her Augment Module also grants her a summon for the early part of the battle, which adds to her damage further. She ideally prefers flagship for maximum barrage impact, but she can work at a slightly worse level when off-flag. Overall, she is a great ship.

Chise Asukagawa.evaluation: Chise Asukagawa is a damage-oriented CV with great stats and skills. She has great personal damage with 8 planes and good stats, as well as an on-strike barrage. She also offers additional damage and support on her 1st (preloaded!) and 3rd airstrikes, which are nice to have. The Augment interaction between her and Rikka is not worth using them together for. Overall, she is a great ship.

Princess Hime.evaluation: Princess Hime is a tank / support-oriented AE with great stats and skills. Her personal damage is alright due to MGM+1 DD guns and some self-buffs. Her support is really good, allowing her to equip both normal <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/List_of_Cargo" title="Cargo" >Cargo</a > and Gridman specific <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/List_of_Cargo" title="Cargo" >Cargo</a > at the same time. She also has enough bulk to Main Tank most content, however her being Light Armor leaves her a bit suspect to high damage HE bullets. Overall, she is a great ship.

Rikka Takarada.evaluation: Rikka Takarada is a damage-oriented CL with great stats and amazing skills. She possesses multiple strong, piercing laser barrages that deal great damage against huge waves of enemies in a row; however, during her downtime her damage is pretty underwhelming. In addition, she can equip multiple Auxiliary equipment at once, although ideally 3 of those slots are the <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Battle_Tracto_Max" title="Battle Tracto Max" >Battle Tracto Max</a >, <a rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" href="https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/wiki/Buster_Borr" title="Buster Borr" >Buster Borr</a >, and Gridman Calibur to get the most barrage benefits possible. Her bulk is also good enough to mob-tank most content reliably. The Augment interaction between her and Chise / Yume is not worth using them together for. Overall, she is an amazing ships when mobbing, and a great ship outside of it.

The 2nd.evaluation: Nibanme is a flagship-oriented BB with great stats and skills. No aux guns hurts her interception capability, but her damage is very good, and comes from multiple sources. Overall, she is a great ship.

Yume Minami.evaluation: Yume Minami is a tank-oriented CA with great stats and skills. Her bulk is a bit on the lower side for a tank, but she has above average damage to make up for it. She has multiple barrages tied to both her guns and skills, giving her great damage variety. The Augment interaction between her and Rikka is not worth using them together for. Overall, she is a great ship.

Hass.evaluation: Hass is a damage-oriented CL with meh stats and skills. Using her to activate Rikka's skill requirement is not recommended. Collection only.
